Sheet1.Title: Start Your Own Gym.... At The Office.
Sheet1.Meta Description: You have an unlimited list of activities you can perform when stuck in the office for hours. Get ideas for office exercises to combat most sedentary habits.
Sheet1.Content:
Rule No. 1: Learn from Ron Burgandy's Sound Office Exercises

Many could argue today that society is full of overweight and uninformed individuals who are not just affecting their own health, but the health of future generations to come and some would blame the individuals themselves for becoming this way. First, lets stand and think. When you’re forced to sit down for eight hours or more a day then surrounded by a majority of fast food restaurants giving you thousands of calories in one meal, the result is predictable and inevitable. When your daily routine is structured such as this, its imperative that you take full advantage of every opportunity possible in order to keep active and improve your health. Starting with taking a little time to prepare meals or find alternative healthy food sources, you can get one step closer to beating the sedentary lifestyle. While your probably going to be without any significant equipment to help you out through the workday, one piece that can greatly benefit you is the exercise ball. Probably costing you ten to twenty dollars, you can feel good spending this minimum amount to help you work you core and posture throughout each day. By making sure the ball itself fits you and your desk size, you can implement small amounts of activity with your newfound “perfect posture”. Putting your toes under the leg of your desk or small cabinet, you can perform a few sit-ups every ten minutes while never leaving your desk chair. 2 Before hitting the desk you can add a few routines to help increase activity throughout your day. Parking in the back of the employee parking lot not only decreases the chance of a car door dinging your car, it also allows you to add steps in a small way that will pay off after days or weeks of work. One more strategy is to ditch the convenience of the elevator and take the stairs, whether you’re on the second floor or the seventh. Beginning your day with this little activity can have huge effects after years of the cubicle job. Now that your seated in your new exercise ball at your desk, and got those extra 100 steps, you can start to change a few things around the office to suit your needs. Putting the stapler or printer a few feet further from your seat allowing you to get up and move to retrieve what you need is a great start.1 How about walking down the hall to talk to a coworker opposed to writing an email? Maybe even walking down the street to get those new business cards instead of having Fed-ex deliver them in two business days. As Ron Burgundy would say, “Tuesday is arms and back”. You may decide to do thousands of shirtless bicep curls in your fishbowl of an office, or be more practical and fully-clothed perform 50 push-ups before and after each phone call—all the small efforts add up. Purchasing some dumbbells or resistance bands for the office are a great way to keep toned and active during the day. Taking advantage of lunch breaks is another great way to increase daily activity, even just walking 15 minutes before your mid-day meal provides tons of benefits. You have an unlimited list of activities you can perform when stuck in the office for hours on end. You may be embarrassed to go for a run during lunch, or occupy the hall with your endless minutes of wall sits, but I can assure you that your work life and personal life will happily condone these activities. Start now, and change what many cannot.

Featured Image Credit: easygethealth.com

  References 1. Emily Milam (May, 28 2014) Deskercise! 33 Smart Ways to Exercise at Work. Retrieved from: http://greatist.com/fitness/deskercise-33-ways-exercise-work 2. Linda Melone (January, 2014) Should You Replace Your Chair for an Exercise Ball? Retrieved from:http://www.prevention.com/fitness/fitness-tips/should-you-replace-your-office-chair-stability-ball

Sheet1.Title: 11 Pieces of Equipment to Complete the CrossFit Gym
Sheet1.Meta Description: With hundreds of options, stick to the basics and choose functional Equipment to complete the crossfit gym. Here's a list of top products for your home gym.
Sheet1.Content:
Whether your joining your first CrossFit gym, or you decided to create your own home gym, there are a few key pieces of equipment that are sure to enhance your results and help you achieve those fitness goals. With the thousands of types of equipment out there that promise you maximum results in only ten minutes a day, its better to ignore the hype and hear-say. Just stick to the basics and let functional movements be your guide. The following list comprises of the key pieces of equipment to look for when joining a gym or making your own:
  • Bumper plates
  • Olympic bar
  • Gymnastic rings
  • Jump rope/speed rope
  • Paralletts
  • Kettlebells
  • Pull-up bar
  • Dumbbells
  • Plyobox
  • Padded medicine ball
  • Rower
You may be looking at these and thinking how expensive it would be to fund your own private crossfit garage, but that’s where paying 20 to 50 dollars a month for a high quality gym may be the better option. This equipment has an unlimited amount of potential in what your able to use it all for, and with the amount of opportunities they provide you, will and determination are the only things standing in your way to success. Body weight exercises can also be a huge advantage when training, helping you increase strength, endurance, and overall functionality with the cost around nothing. Though these are a staple in almost any training regime, supplementing with all this equipment will push your limits and allow for a wider array of training that you cant imitate with anything else. You may decide to substitute a few parts of this list with some of your own much-needed equipment that you believe will benefit you, but the assortment we provide is the foundation of crossfit equipment that will be found at any big name gym across the world. From a personal standpoint, there are a few things that most crossfit athletes believe you must have in order to complete the environment of a crossfit gym. As with many fitness lovers, sometimes the only thing you need to get you through your workout is your personalized music playlist. Jamming to the beats of your favorite 90’s boy band, or the screams of your ultimate metal playlist may push you through that last 20 minutes of your daily WOD. Once you have the music, its time get your own stopwatch. Maybe it hangs from your neck and reminds you of your junior high track coach. Perhaps your stopwatch has an integrated heart rate monitor, GPS, calorie tracker, and instant espresso maker—either way that stopwatch will allow you to time your workouts. Once you notice change in your times of each daily workout, its time to get the big bland whiteboard with some expo markers to start keeping track of the goals your demolishing. But if you don’t enjoy carrying a 4x4 foot whiteboard, a journal and pen should do the job great. Applying the benefits of all this equipment with a high quality nutritional plan will help you dominate those personal goals. Whether those goals may be to find the hidden six pack you haven’t seen since grade school, or train to become the new face of the crossfit games—this foundation will get you there.
  References 1.Lance Fischer (October 01, 2014) 25 Items a Crossfit Garage Gym Can't Live Without. Retrieved from: http://www.bilderz.com/blog/25-items-a-crossfit-garage-gym-cant-live-without.html
Sheet1.Categories: Everything CrossFit | How To | Lifestyle Design

Sheet1.Title: Are You Shorting Your Body the Benefits of Egg White Protein Powder?
Sheet1.Meta Description: For the best possible fitness gains open yourself up to the health and performance benefits of egg white protein powder.
Sheet1.Content:
Hey there, do you even lift, bro? Are you stocking up on Whey Protein and hitting the gym like a boss? Well here’s a question for you: ever considered you're cutting yourself out of the benefits of egg white protein powder? Egg White protein has often been over looked when compared to Whey or Casein, but it actually has many benefits as a supplement and it is something that ought be considered to include in your diet for the best possible gains. Egg white powder is dehydrated (dried) egg whites. AMRAP Bars use egg white protein powder in their Paleo Refuel bars because of the numerous health benefits that it provides. At AMRAP, we only use egg white powder from growth hormone-free chickens. Egg protein has the highest biological value because of its combination of essential amino acids and sulfur containing proteins, all of which can be used by the body for natural, healthy muscle maintenance. In addition, egg whites are high in protein and contain no cholesterol or fats. This helps you reach your optimal protein absorption without worrying about taking in unwanted components.1 Advantages of Egg Whites (Dehydrated Powder) There are hundreds of protein powders on the market; it’s a very large product category with many options to choose from. They all do a good job of supplementing protein in your diet, however, egg white protein is2:
  • More convenient than protein rich foods such as meats, fish, eggs, and dairy
  • Non-perishable when stored in an airtight container
  • Price: saves money when compared to high-protein foods like meats and fish
  • Beneficial to the body in more ways than just supplying extra protein
  • Great tasting and can be used for the whole family
Health Benefits of Egg White Protein Vs. Other Proteins on the Market Protein is an important element to every cell in the body. It forms the foundations of muscles, bones, tissues and blood. Egg white protein is one of the best sources for muscle gain and building lean body mass. It also is:
  • Loaded with essential amino acids you need for muscle maintenance, recovery, and growth.
  • Optimal digestive speed to help build muscle and prevent muscle breakdown
  • Provides nourishment, blocks digestive enzymes, and contains important vitamins, minerals, and carbohydrates
  • Egg White is a complete protein- it provides your body with amino acids that your body doesn’t naturally produce on its own
  • High protein content without the cholesterol and fat found in yolks
  • Rich in Riboflavin which the body needs for cell growth
  • Lactose free for those with a dairy allergy
  • Cholesterol and/or fat free
  • No artificial sweeteners, preservatives, flavors, or colors
There are also many other important benefits- such as digestion speed, amino acid content, and no extra fat. Whey is fast digesting to build muscles, casein (milk) is slow digesting to help prevent muscle breakdown, and moderate digesting egg white protein does both by continually supplying your muscles with amino acids to help build muscle and prevent muscle breakdown, which is what you want. It is also key when picking a protein supplement to be aware of the amino acid content. We all know that amino acids are the building blocks are protein. Your body makes 10 amino acids, but there are also 10 other essential amino acids that must be obtained through food. A food that contains all 10 of these is known as a complete protein, and guess what? Egg white powder is a complete protein. Other proteins, such as plant-based proteins like rice or pea, are incomplete. You might be thinking, why not just eat eggs? While whole eggs are a good source of protein, they also come with the added fat and calories. One large egg contains around 5 grams of fat. It would take 4 whole eggs to get the same amount of protein as you would with the egg white protein powder, which unfortunately adds the extra 20 grams of added fat.3 Egg white protein is an ideal protein source for your active and exciting lifestyle. It is important to know what you are putting into your body and also, where it came from. It is clean protein that you can feel great about using it. Reap all of the benefits that it provides!  
References: 1. (2014). All Natural Egg White Protein. Retrieved from: http://www.bodybuilding.com/store/mrm/eggwhite.html 2. Marc G. Taylor, M.S. Choosing a Protein Powder. Retrieved from http://www.nutritionexpress.com/article+index/authors/mark+g+taylor+ms/showarticle.aspx?articleid=896 3. Mike Samuels. (March 04, 2014). What Are the Benefits of Egg-White Protein Powder? Retrieved from http://www.livestrong.com/article/481383-what-are-the-benefits-of-egg-white-protein-powder/
Sheet1.Categories: Interesting Other | Nutrition Hacks | Performance Advice

Sheet1.Title: Add Some Pizzazz With These Perfect DIY Paleo Snacks
Sheet1.Meta Description: What’s the best option to fight drowsiness and hunger? DIY Paleo snacks! They are designed to keep your blood sugar levels stable and under control.
Sheet1.Content:
You're Day is Only as Great as Your Totable Snacks

We know that life gets hectic and busy; sometimes it feels like there just aren’t enough hours in the day. While you’re on the go or at work, you don’t always have the time to eat a delicious and nutritional meal. You might go for what is most convenient; perhaps an energy drink, candy bars, or chips in the snack machine at the office. The problem with those is that they actually do way more harm than good. While they do give you a short sugary energy boost, you will end up finding yourself crashing hard shortly after and feeling worse off over time. Why? The sugar from those products is let into your blood stream far too quickly, then your blood sugar levels drop and you are left to crash and burn. So, what’s the best option to fight drowsiness and hunger? Paleo snacks! They process differently in your body and are designed to keep your blood sugar levels stable and under control. They pack in the nutrition and give you clean raw fuel and consistent energy to power through your day. They are tasty little treats that will make your tummy happy. Whenever hunger strikes, keep these snacks in mind when you want some Paleo deliciousness:   Smoothies: Who doesn’t a love delicious and fresh smoothie? Packed with antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals-this a perfect pick me up. Try Parsley and Pear (with apple, plum, banana, and avocado) or a refreshing Paleo Peach Coconut Smoothie. Can you say, YUM?! Add a hard boiled egg on the side for some extra protein and you’re good to go!   Tomato Pesto Bites: Grab some cherry tomatoes with some extra-virgin olive oil, garlic, basil, and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano. Slice a small section from the bottom (enough for them to stand up) then slice off the top, scoop out the seeds and stuff them with the blended pesto/basil/garlic/Parmigiano Reggiano. Drizzle some olive oil and a dash of salt and pepper to taste!  (Sub cheese for garlic baked cauliflower for true Paleo!)   Avacado Egg Salad Lettuce Wraps with Bacon: 1 ripe avocado, lemon juice, 4 hard boiled eggs(chilled) celery, chopped parsley, salt and pepper, 1 head buttercrunch lettuce or 4-5 endive bulbs, 1-2 slices of cooked bacon. Mash up the avocado and lemon juice, grate the eggs and add in the chopped celery, parsley, and seasonings into the bowl. Refrigerate for up to 2 hours and then spoon into the lettuce cups- add some bacon on top and you are set. Are you salivating yet? I am!   Fig and Strawberry Cashew Bars: 1 cup of dried figs and strawberries, salt, honey, coconut oil, 1 cup unsalted cashews. Add figs and strawberries in a food processor; add in salt, coconut oil, and honey, pulse in cashews. Line pan with wax paper and after refrigerating for 2 hours, cut into squares and you’re ready! Healthy and delicious…life can’t get much better.   Paleo Hummus and Veggie Slices: All you need is cauliflower florets, cumin, paprika, salt, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic cloves, olive oil and an oven and you’re set! Then, add all of your favorite veggies and dip away into mouthwatering bliss.   Who said Paleo and going back to the dietary basics couldn’t be fun? These snacks are just a few of the hundreds of delicious and amazing Paleo foods out there. Think of your body as a fancy sports car, in order for that car to run properly and smoothly-it must have the best fuel. Now picture your body as that car- by eating Paleo, you are filling up your temple with the best, raw, healthiest ingredients there are. Don’t forget your AMRAP 100% Paleo Refuel Bars for some added awesomeness. By all means, eat up and enjoy all of these treats- you bet we are!   For full recipes and instructions visit references below.  
References: 1. Jennifer Farley (February 6, 2014). 20 Easy Paleo Recipes For Beginners + An Introduction to the Paleo Diet. Retrieved from: http://parade.condenast.com/260202/jenniferfarley/20-easy-paleo-recipes-for-beginners-an-introduction-to-the-paleo-diet/ 2. David Tao (June 13, 2014). 51 Paleo Snacks Anyone Can Love. Retrieved from: http://greatist.com/health/paleo-recipes-list  3. http://paleogrubs.com/smoothie-recipes 4. http://www.savorysimple.net/tomato-pesto-bites/ 5. http://www.pintsizedbaker.com/2013/10/wlw-fig-and-strawberry-cashew-bars.html 6. http://www.livinpaleocuisine.com/2013/02/05/paleo-hummus/

Sheet1.Title: CrossFit Hack: Easy Tweaks to Boost Cardiovascular Endurance
Sheet1.Meta Description: Cardiovascular endurance is lacking in CrossFit athletes. Eat nutrient-dense foods, introduce variety to your exercises, and manage your stress levels.
Sheet1.Content:
Life isn’t a sprint. It’s a marathon. Filled with a lifetime of challenges, successes and failures. You need the strength to iendure, every minute, every year, every decade. Tennyson believed we’re all “one equal temper of heroic hearts, made weak by time and fate.” But for us endurance athletes out there, I think we can make our hearts just a little stronger by the energy we spend improving our lives. Fuel your health, your heroic heart. Every day, our hearts beat 100,000 times sending 2,000 gallons of blood through our bodies. Although it’s no bigger than our fist–just 11 ounces–our heart has the constant task of keeping blood flowing through 60,000 miles of arteries, veins, and capillaries that feed our body’s vital tissues and organs. The human heart does the most physical work of any muscle during our lifetimes–twice as hard as the leg muscles of a sprinter–and beats up to 2.5 billion times. Any damage to our heart or its valves can reduce it’s pumping power, forcing it to work harder just to keep up with our body’s insane demand for blood. So first thing’s first. We need a fresh new start for a healthier heart.1 A fresh start begins in our bellies. Oprah Winfrey tells us “we eat what’s in our fridge.” That makes sense, right? So we need our diet to be a little more conducive to improving our cardiovascular endurance. We need whole, organic foods that are rich in vitamins, nutrients, and minerals that will protect our precious little pumpers. Try some of these heart-boosting foods:
  • Coconuts, and avocados
  • Egg whites
  • Olive, krill, and coconut oil
  • Raw nuts and seeds
  • Organic, grass-fed meats
  • Wild Salmon
  • Whole Apples
  • Fresh, natural water
Fresh new fridge, check. Now let’s do some field tests. The best exercises for improving cardiovascular endurance are activities that elevate your heart rate, keeping it elevated for sustained periods of time. By exercising in order to elevate your heart rate, you strengthen your heart. You improve your natural blood flow. You burn that fat. You improve your ability to deliver oxygen to your muscles. All of these are the hallmarks of cardiovascular endurance.2 Try a few of these heart-boosting exercises:
  • Fast-paced walking,
  • Swimming
  • Running
  • Cycling
  • Cross-country skiing
  • In-line skating
  • Jumping Rope
Fresh new exercises, check. Maintaining and improving this endurance is a lot of work. Remember, life isn’t a sprint–it’s a marathon. Healthy diet and exercise–we’re in it for the long haul. Every creature on earth has approximately two billion heartbeats to spend in a lifetime.3 So make them count. Eat nutrient-dense Paleo foods, introduce a strong variety to your exercises, and manage your stress levels. If you can tackle the first two, they’ll directly impact the third. Remember, we are powerful beyond measure. “That which we are, we are; one equal temper of heroic hearts, made weak by time and fate, but strong in will, to strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield.”4  

Featured image by: GBTimes

REFERENCES

  2. Sloan, Jim (2013, Dec 8). Exercise to Improve Cardiovascular Endurance. Retrieved from http://www.livestrong.com/article/105668-exercises-improve-cardiovascular- endurance/
  1. Doyle, Brian (2004). Joyas Volardores. Retreived from: http://theamericanscholar.org/ joyas-volardores/#.VBMyREuRPwI
  2. Lord Tennyson, Alfred. The Poetry Society (2014). Ulysses. Retreived from: http:// www.poetrysociety.org.uk/content/skyfall/

Sheet1.Title: Maximize Mornings with 3 Paleo Breakfast Ideas
Sheet1.Meta Description: Paleo breakfast doesn't have to be complicated to be healthy and maximize your energy levels and mental performance. Use these Paleo breakfast ideas often.
Sheet1.Content:
Breakfast is a big deal. Depending on your fitness performance goals, giving your body some proper nutrition first thing in the morning will give you the jumpstart you need to power through your day. Paleo breakfasts are packed with clean protein and healthy fats, not to mention they’re absolutely delicious. Make breakfast something to look forward to with these easy, simple, and fun Paleo foods!

Eggs and Meats-We love eggs because they are simple and can be prepared so many different ways. Eggs are highly nutritious and loaded with protein for the perfect start to your day. Fried eggs, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs - or throw in some chicken and bacon (for added protein and bulking), with some avocados and tomatoes to make a delicious omelet. If you’re on the run, they’re are quick and will give you just what you need.

Green Vegetables-Who wants veggies for breakfast? WE DO! That might seem like an odd idea, but mix some spinach or kale in your favorite smoothie with some water, fresh fruits, and juice and it is a perfect way to get those healthy greens into your daily diet.

Ripe Fruits-They contain many essential nutrients and are loaded with vitamins and antioxidants. Vitamin-C helps grow and repair your body tissues and potassium maintains healthy blood pressure while the antioxidants work to remove free radicals from the body. Most fruits are naturally low in fat, calories, sodium, and free from cholesterol. From berries and bananas to apples and oranges, fruits are a wonderful go-to food for the mornings.

Give your body some Paleo nutrition to start your day off right. Get out there, and get moving, let the right breakfast jumpstart your need to power through. Healthy diet, strong body, can’t lose!
Sheet1.Categories: Interesting Other | Nutrition Hacks | Paleo Recipes

Sheet1.Title: The Best Nitric Oxide Pre Workout Supplement
Sheet1.Meta Description: For the athlete looking for performance without sacrificing longterm health, look for the best nitric oxide pre workout supplement available. Here are tips.
Sheet1.Content:
Dietary supplements are a mixed bag, especially the pre-workout supplement space. If you are like me, you are distrustful of white powdery supplements making grand promises. It’s not food. How will your body break it down without sacrificing your long term health? While it is true that we should get the majority of nutrients from our diet, pairing that along with high quality supplements can take you from the “new years resolution” gym goer to the athlete of the year. Fortunately there are places to find natural organic Nitric oxide supplements that offer performance at no cost to your more vital organs. Your heart will actually be happy. Nitric oxide is one supplement you want to pay attention to. Nitric oxide aid isn’t just beneficial to athletes and fitness gurus, but for the average American just trying to increase their overall health. Nitric oxide production within the body on a daily basis helps with cardiovascular health. So how can you boost the level of nitric oxide your body produces? First understand, nitric oxide is naturally produced in the human body. When foods with high nitrate content are consumed, the body will convert nitrates into nitric oxide. From there, nitric oxide delivers a host of benefits, including:
  • Lowers blood pressure
  • Boosts stamina
  • Increases blood flow to the brain
  • Reduces cancer risk
By increasing blood flow, the body is then aided in the prevention of high blood pressure. And if you don’t know, nearly 31% of Americans have high blood pressure [1]. High blood pressure can result in heart attacks and stroke, so it would only make sense to decrease the likelihood of these health concerns by increasing your nitrate consumption. One common topic of athletes in this newly transformed industry is a pre-workout booster. The reason for pre-workout supplements is to help give your body and mind that motivational edge when stepping in the gym or starting your training session. The primary help of ntiric oxide supplements is to assist your body in creating more nitric oxide in the blood to help dilate the veins and arteries to increase blood flow, which boosts the process of nutrient transportation as well as the transportation of oxygen to your working muscle fibers. Many of these pre-workout formulas contain essential amino acids such as L-arginine or L-Citruline to aid in the formation of NO within the body. [2] By encouraging higher production of nitric oxide, exercise becomes less exhaustive and athletes are able to endure exercises for extended time periods. Some more natural sources that contain these nitric oxide compounds include:
  • Beetroot (Beets)
  • Carrots
  • Leafy greens such as spinach and kale
  • Grass-fed meats
  • Strawberries
Vegetables contain the highest healthy form of nitrates per gram but you may also get nitric oxide benefits from L-arginine and L-citruline in concentrated formulas. While these two amino acids have positive effects on the body, many are present in processed, stimulant filled pre-workouts. In order to get the best possible results, the natural choice is the best choice. If buying pounds of fresh vegetables to fuel your body before a daily workout is not within your budget plan, you can find much more simplistic and healthy pre-workout options to increase your nitric oxide production. In the past, highly processed sugary drinks, chews, etc. have corned the pre-workout supplement. Controversial opinions swirl over the nutritional value of processed pre-workout supplements; this is causing many people to consider alternative nutrient-dense food supplements to deliver enhanced sports performance. Organic concentrated beetroot juice is emerging as an effective food-based pre-workout alternative. When you decide to take a stand and start researching for yourself, you can truly decide on what’s best for you and your own body. What works for one person might not work for you, so let this be the start where you can gather your own knowledge and conduct a plan of execution for a healthy and happy life.

Featured Image by: CrossFit Refinery

References
  1. CDC- High blood pressure facts. http://www.cdc.gov/bloodpressure/facts.htm
  1. Pronutritionist- Nitrates are beneficial. http://www.pronutritionist.net/nitrates-are-beneficial-where-did-i-get-it-wrong/

Sheet1.Title: Caveman Fuel: Paleo Snacks On the Go
Sheet1.Meta Description: Sweet, savory, and convenient Paleo snacks on the go. 3 snacks you can prep at home or buy from a preferred Paleo store depending on your need.
Sheet1.Content:
“Life moves pretty fast, if we don’t stop and look around once in a while, you could miss it.”1 But hey, we’re also athletes, parents, students, managers, friends…the list goes on. We don’t have that kind of time. We work, work out, eat, sleep, and repeat. That’s our everyday life. Sometimes we need to grab some Paleo snacks on the go. Here’s some quick snacks for the everyday CrossFit enthusiast on the move. Everything you need to fuel your inner caveman.  
  1. Fuel Your Inner Canine: Beef Jerky Paleo Snack. I love jerky. But, it's even better when I make jerky on my own. From the forest to my fridge...yeah. This recipe will help. It has the perfect little blend of spices to get the meat just right. You’ll never buy store bought jerky again. Choose lean cuts of sirloin to make it. Then add some spices: garlic powder, and onion powder. Spruce it up with a little red wine, you'll thank us later. How To: (2)
 
  1. Fuel Your Inner Nomad: Blueberry Apple Pie Trail Mix Balls This recipe requires Paleo Krunch Apple Cereal for texture and flavor, and throw in some almonds and dehydrated apple chunks. Mix all of the ingredients, form them into balls, and chill for a great, bake-less snack. Super plentiful for both hikers and early risers. Get out there and foriage for more paleo ingredients, just watch out for those wildebeests. How To: (3)
 
  1. Fuel Your Inner Child: Double Chocolate Brownies Ingredients: 2 cups of almond butter, 3 eggs, 1 cup raw organic honey, melted, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, 1/2 cup dark cocoa powder, 1/2 teaspoon sea salt, 1 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 cup Enjoy Life chocolate chips, melted (or dark chocolate), 1 very ripe banana. Prep time-10 minutes, cook time-45 minutes. How To: (4)
  Yummy. Now you’re one happy caveman CrossFit super athlete. Paleo snacks are where its at–on the go Paleo! Healthy, and Delicious. What else do you really need? This is your lifestyle, you’ve got to have some fun with it. Find clean fuel for your lifestyle. #AMRAP

Sheet1.Title: Fluids and Fuel: Nutrition for CrossFit Endurance
Sheet1.Meta Description: High-intensity endurance is designed to last anywhere from 30 minutes to 17 hours. Nutrition for crossFit endurance demands adequate food and hydration.
Sheet1.Content:
The human body is incredible. We were built to succeed. We climb mountains, swim ocean channels, run across deserts, and cycle across countries. Faster. Stronger. Further. We train for the insane ability to endure more pain. We do it for fun, the sporting aspect, for that mad war against gravity and inertia. Physical dominance is our greatest natural conquest–it separates us, man from beast–survival of the fittest. Popularity in endurance challenges continues to rise. The long runs, the grueling WODS, the endless cycling. These sports test our souls. Every year, more and more people are testing the very limits of their mitochondrial intake on endurance sports. Most high-intensity endurance challenges are designed to last anywhere from 30 minutes to 17 hours. That’s taxing. Endurance nutrition at this level requires refueling of the most spectacular kind, high carbohydrate consumption and adequate hydration. Optimize your nutrition for CrossFit endurance to see higher performance.   THE FUELS Carbohydrates, lean proteins, and healthy fats–all you need to provide your body with the right fuel. It’s the right stuff. Endurance athletes should aim for 45-65% of daily calories from carbohydrates, 15-20 % from proteins and 20-35 %percent from fats. Carbohydrates provide the perfect fuel for most endurance activities. They’re easily digested, quickly used. Adequate carbs prevent fatigue and injury. They save your battery life, keep you drumming. Carbohydrates are a primary fuel for exercise and sports, especially moderate to high intensities. Healthy fats are vital source of energy for lengthy, lower to moderate intensities. You’re body needs to store it–it’s like endurance insurance for those long, grueling days on the grind. Endurance terrain is unforgiving. Protein is pretty important. Okay, it’s really important, especially to the high-intensity CrossFit athlete. It helps build and repair muscles, aids in fluid balance and promotes immune function–you fight the good fight. Protein is also used fuel for endurance exercise and sport. Endurance athletes need more protein than regular folks. They’re just not on our level.1 Walnuts are a plant-based protein, rich in fiber, rich in vitamins and antioxidants. They contain the most Omega-3 fatty acids than any other nut and the anti-inflammatory nutrients are great for bone health. Make a great energizing and healthy snack. Cherries are one of the most antioxidant-rich fruit and provide high performance and recovery benefits. The post-exercise benefits are astonishing because of the fruit's natural anti-inflammatory components. You’ll fight soreness more efficiently. Bananas are your best before and after snacks. Loaded with Potassium and Vitamin B6, bananas help restock your body with lost electrolytes after any sort of physical exertion. Vitamin B6 is a natural anti-inflammatory. Kale contains vitamins, calcium, and iron and it’s an antioxidant-rich vegetable that helps regulate the body's inflammatory process. It’s a darn good veggie. Salmon is one of the most nutrient dense proteins on the planet. Salmon can help reduce inflammation in our bodies through it's high content of Omega-3's. The antioxidants in salmon are beneficial for cardiovascular protection. Simply put, it protects your heart.1 Your heart’s got about two billion beats in your lifetime, so keep it healthy.   THE FLUIDS Dehydration prior to your endurance trek is all too common. It’ll ruin your whole day. Whether you’re on a training run or race day, drinking adequate fluids before go-time is a game changer. If you don’t, you’ll burn out. You’ll fry the machine. You’ll melt the engine. You’re body needs to be ready. Four hours ready to be precise. Athletes need to be drinking 20-30 ounces prior to the beginning of their race. Remaining hydrated throughout your exercise is just as important too. You have to maintain your thermoregulation–you’ve got to keep that system cool. You also need to minimize your body mass loss through sweating. Limit weight loss more than 2-3% during exercises that last more than 90 minutes.2 What have we learned? Maximizing our endurance is crucial. Proper nutrition for crossfit endurance is essential for success. Fuel depletion and fluid dehydration are the greatest obstacles we’ll face as endurance athletes. Carbohydrates, healthy fats, lean protein, and good old’ fashioned will keep your body in check. You’ve got to be the tortoise. You’ve got to stay for the long haul…for as many rounds as possible. #AMRAP  

Featured Image By: CrossFit Redbank

References
  1. Barger, Alana. (2014, September). Top 10 Superfoods for Endurance Athletes. Retrieved from: http://www.active.com/nutrition/articles/top-10-superfoods-for- endurance-athletes
  2. Jeukendrup, Asker E. (2011, September 15) Nutrition for Endurance Sports: Marathon, Triathlon, and Road Cycling. Retrieved from: http://www.tandfonline. com/doi/abs/10.1080/.VBxU8kuRPwI

Sheet1.Title: Why Athletes Care About 8 Health Benefits of Beetroot
Sheet1.Meta Description: The health benefits of beetroot are something athletes within CrossFit need to pay attention to. There are at least eight major benefits in beetroot.
Sheet1.Content:
Roman gladiators fought like gods. Their ideology was simple–to live like champions, to succeed, to endure, and to conquer: Deos fortioribus adesse–The gods are on the side of the stronger.1   The genesis of Roman strength came from within–literally. They trained the hardest. They fought the longest. They never quit (well, mostly). Also, they ate the best stuff on Earth. The insatiable appetites of Rome’s mightiest soldiers included a healthy dose of beetroot. The health benefits of beetroot are astounding.   I’m not a gladiator. But I train like one, and I damn sure eat like one. When I walk into my Crossfit gym, I’m ready to do battle–like a warrior poet, Once more into the fray… Into the last good fight I’ll ever know. Live and die on this day… Live and die on this day...2 After my WOD I want to leave the gym exhausted, like I gave everything to that day–like I never saved anything for the swim back–so to speak.               Beetroot can be purple, golden, and pink, but it’s typically dark red–its a vegetable with a hell of an acquired taste–sweet, earthy and tender. Ancient Romans used beetroot as a treatment for fevers and thought the leaves were good for binding wounds.3 A smart choice after running a high temperature from taking a Scottish spear to the abdomen.   Romans typically ate them raw, and people have been doing the same for thousands of years–its Paleo. Beetroot tastes so yummy because of its high sugar content–it also has holds nutritional value worthy of a Centurion.               Calcium: Great for building strong bones and teeth. Assists blood clots. Sends and receives nerve signals. Squeezes and relaxes muscles. Releases hormones and other chemicals. Helps keep a normal heartbeat, Aids in intense aerobic exercises.4 Iron: Assists in the transportation of oxygen. Aids the production of red blood cells–binding them to oxygen, facilitating transport from lungs to arteries to all cells in the body. Converts blood sugar into metabolic energy.5       Vitamin A: Promotes healthy eyesight. Strengthens night vision. Helps the body fight off infection. Sustains the immune system. Supports bone growth and remodeling–especially helpful for when you accidently take a kettlebell to the kneecap.6             Vitamin C: Needed for tissue growth, and repair. Forms important proteins used to make skin, tendons, ligaments, and blood vessels. Heals wounds. Helps create scar tissue. Repairs and maintain cartilage, bones, and teeth.7             Manganese: Formation of connective tissues. Assists the absorption of calcium. Generates proper functioning of the thyroid gland, and sex hormones. Regulates blood sugar level. Metabolizes fats and carbohydrates.8     Nitrites: Help open blood vessels in the body, increasing blood flow and oxygen. Includes, nitric oxide, which increases blood flow to the brain. Helps improve overall cerebral functions.9 Makes you a smarter, faster CrossFit warrior.             Potassium: A very important mineral for the human body. Builds proteins. Breaks down and uses carbohydrates. Builds muscle. Maintains normal body growth. Controls the electrical activity of the heart. Controls acid-base balances.10             Fiber: Helps maintain levels of antioxidant enzymes–essential for cellular growth in the body, Increases the number of white blood cells. Builds the immune system. Strengthens resistance to diseases.11 Helps your eternal fight against influenza.   In the words of Marcus Aurelius, when you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive–to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.12 “Carpe diem!” Strengthen your body with a daily dose of beetroot. It’ll help build your inner warrior. And, when you walk into your Crossfit gym–train like a gladiator–think of it as your own personal arena, your Roman Coliseum.  

Featured Image By: CrossFit RallyPoint

Sheet1.Title: Sugar As Addictive As Cocaine
Sheet1.Meta Description: Discover how you can improve your health by limiting intake of processed sugar (white sugar, brown sugar, powdered sugar, etc).
Sheet1.Content:
Discover how sugar is killing you and your family...

As a nation, 95% of us are on track to be overweight and in a few years 30% of our population will have diabetes. Thats right, that simple sugar packet you add to your morning coffee is killing you and the sugar found on frosted flakes is poisoning your children. So you might be wondering "how do I go about breaking my sugar addiction". Lucky for you Psychology Today has a great five step article on breaking sugar addictions (summarized below):
  1. Find different rewards, instead of a cupcake; get a massage.
  2. Don't switch to a new bad habits (ie. give up sugar for potato chips).
  3. If you need a sweet treat, find something made with raw honey.
  4. Don't test it, one little donut could send you back to rehab
  5. Finally, it's not welcome; don't have any sugar in the house!
We need to join together and inform our friends and family of the dangers and addicting qualities of processed sugar (white sugar, brown sugar, powdered sugar). Together we can do this, but first learn more by watching the movie Fed Up this weekend with a loved one... [embed]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aCUbvOwwfWM[/embed] Eliminating processed sugars from the American diet is something we are very passionate about and is the reason why we use honey to sweeten our line of amazingly awesome delicious AMRAP Bars.
Personally we have found the best way to break this addiction is to  go 'cold-turkey'. Simply put just go on a 24-hour fast, eat a big dinner wake up to a crazy busy day and just drink a lot of coffee and water (for some reason we've noticed that coffee reduces food cravings as does a mid day workout and if you're busy you wont notice how hungry you are). That night go home and have a fantastic salad with lots of fats (olive oil, avocado) and some meat, lots of meat.
Sheet1.Image Alt Text: your brain on sugar and cocaine, addiction

Sheet1.Title: Lindy Barber | CrossFit Inspiration
Sheet1.Content:
[embed]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MWwobEbaac4[/embed]
Lindy Barber broke her back in 2011. Doctors told her she would never squat again. "I am absolutely stronger than my injury. Just because it is something that i will have to deal with in my everyday life it does not mean it is something that will affect how I live my life every single day. Please don't give up. Find your goals, set your sights on those goals and don't allow that injury to define who you are or who you can be in your life." Lindy Barber- CrossFit Games Athlete.
Video compliments of: ShaughnTillmanFilms

Sheet1.Title: Paleo lunch ideas for the workplace
Sheet1.Meta Description: It can be difficult to get a good paleo lunch in the workplace. Here are some tasty, easy paleo lunch ideas that will fit your diet just right.
Sheet1.Content:
For many in the workforce, lunchtime in the office is a hit-or-miss endeavor defined by junk food and heavily processed, on-the-go items. For a CrossFit athlete on a paleo diet, lunchtime in the office is an opportunity to refuel the body and be inventive in the process. It’s a beautiful thing, regardless of whether the nearest available cooking implement is microwave, fire or nothing at all. Whether you’re a habitual portion counter looking to lose weight or a free-wheeling athlete, your midday paleo meal at work doesn’t have to be a total bore. Our ancestors had some tasty nutrition at their fingertips, and so do we. Here is a fistful of awesome paleo lunch ideas:
  • Better salad — Chef salad is a noonbreak mainstay that you can amp up with hard-boiled eggs, ham or bacon. Why not experiment?
  • Avocado soup, anyone? — Avocado is a fatty, high-protein paleo favorite, partly because it’s such a multi-dimensional food. This sweet fruit can serve as a complement to other ingredients or as the base of a killer recipe, such as Cream of Avocado Soup with Dungeness Crab.
  • Wrap session — While your nonpaleo co-workers are choking down white-bread sandwiches, you can be the envy of the office with a nifty wrap. Carve out a bit of time to prepare some well-seasoned meat and veggies the night before. Then bring the premade mixture and high-quality lettuce to work, and you’ll have several days’ worth of lunch all set.
This also is a fantastic way to use up those leftovers from your carefully planned paleo dinners.
  • A good egg — It’s difficult to go wrong with a hard-boiled egg. That said, many of us get bored with the same plastic container filled with those routine eggs, day after day.
Change things up with palette-pleasing lunch fare such as a bacon jalapeno egg salad sandwich or basil avocado bacon deviled eggs. Amino acids have never tasted so good.
  • For some, lunch is an afterthought — especially with the boss constantly down your throat about the Anderson account (whatever that is). For these noon-hour meal skippers, a well-crafted paleo energy bar might just be the perfect compromise.
3, 2, 1, eat lunch!   Featured Image By: www.Eatwellworkwell.org
Sheet1.Categories: Lifestyle Design | Nutrition Hacks | Paleo Recipes

Sheet1.Title: 4 Infallible Tips for Explaining Paleo Concerns
Sheet1.Meta Description: For those who embrace the paleo lifestyle, it can be difficult explaining the diet. Here are easy tips for explaining paleo with passion and conviction.
Sheet1.Content:
Patience, patience. It’s easy to get frustrated with an uninformed paleo naysayer. But it’s better to be prepared than angry. Some people are just haters who have no interest in reasonable discourse about the paleo lifestyle. Others are jealous of CrossFit athletes and want to rag on anything associated with it. But most actually have valid questions and concerns about paleo. Here are a few tips for explaining paleo to someone who doesn’t understand: Start with the basics No one enjoys being bragged to or talked down to, so don’t submit your potential paleo converts to this type of junk. Don’t dwell on high-level details until the listener begins to comprehend the basics. In other words, start with the importance of our ancestors, not with keto gains. Be brief We’re living in a world dominated by Twitter, Instagram and vines, and people want info as quickly as possible. So, leave the long-winded rants at home. Instead work on a well-thought, concise summary of why primal eating makes sense. Pass the eye test Look around. More importantly, look at people’s phones. If you don’t have images, you won’t anyone’s attention. When you have a chance to talk about paleo, consider using colorful, easy-to-understand infographics as a guide. Know the misconceptions Your opinions about the paleo way likely will be met with questions — some valid, some ridiculous. Many of these misguided ideas are based on erroneous facts, such as:
  1. Paleo eaters are snobs. — The people who embrace this lifestyle are concerned with the health of them and their families. If caring about the well-being of loved ones is wrong, so be it.
  2. Paleo eaters eat nothing but meat. — Some of the most beloved paleo recipe ingredients are outside the meat family, including avocadoes, sweet potatoes, and tons of fresh fruits and vegetables.
  3. Paleo is a weight-loss fad. — Eating the way cavemen did is much more about overall, preventive health than weight loss. That said, many people will see big differences in their bodies once they radically improve their diet.
Perhaps more than anything, remember to be patient. Answer the questions, ignore the haters and offer honest information whenever appropriate.  

Featured Image By: Hermamas.com

Sheet1.Title: Paleo Apps That Make Life Easier
Sheet1.Meta Description: There are many mobile apps that can make your paleo lifestyle easier. Here are some excellent paleo apps that make life easier.
Sheet1.Content:
Who says throwback living and cutting-edge technology can’t coexist? The paleolithic lifestyle is all about nutrition and exercise principles based on how our ancestors lived. But there’s no reason we can’t utilize the fruits of our species’ technological advancements along the path to better well-being. We the people love our phones and tablets, so here are 5 paleo mobile apps that make life easier on a daily basis: Paleo.io It doesn’t get any easier than this: Type in the name of a food and this app tells you whether it’s paleo. For example: Grass-fed and organic meats = “Eat This,” while beans and legumes = “Not This.” Further, once you identify those powerful paleo foods, Paeleo.io provides many intriguing recipes to choose from. Nom Nom Paleo Nom Nom Paleo is well-known for its array of innovative paleo recipes, but there’s more to it than ho-hum bullet points and ingredient lists. The step-by-step instructions feature big, crisps images, plus there is a really handy interactive shopping list. PaleoGoGo A restaurant can be a frustrating place for a paleo eater. Luckily PaleoGoGo takes some of the pressure off. This app provides a quick way to figure out which menu items at a variety of restaurants are OK to eat. It’s a lifestyle saver! Paleo Complete The simple, simple, simple nature of Paleo Complete makes it great for people who are busy, busy, busy. This app’s best characteristic is that users can track their meals, exercise progress and more all in one place. A Beginner’s Guide to Paleo OK, so maybe you’re a paleo newbie. Perhaps you don’t yet feel accepted by the “in crowd” — with the CrossFit athletes and ardent avocado advocates of the world. If that’s you, have no primal fear. The “A Beginner’s Guide to Paleo” app is a great way to get your questions answered quickly. Learn fast, eat well, train hard and find the beast inside you! Take a look at these paleo apps and many others. Even an old-school lifestyle can benefit from some new-school tools.  

Image Credit: 148Apps.com

Sheet1.Title: Cardiovascular Endurance Explained: What Makes Humans So Adaptable?
Sheet1.Meta Description: cardiovascular endurance explained
Sheet1.Content:
Feel Good About Your Genetic Athletic Potential

I’ve always wanted to be in the kind of shape where I could wake up and run a marathon if I felt like it. Well, last weekend I did it. I ran 26.2 miles with basically no distance training. I just ate ‘paleoranically’ and did crossfit. My longest run logged was no more than six miles. Everytime I run a marathon, I’m amazed that I’m able to accomplish such a feat. I feel like I can never really train for 26.2 anyway. I just listen to the experts and emulate their training regimens. Besides, on race day all bets are off. It’s an any given Sunday sort-a thing. However, as a human being, I’ve learned that this kind of performance-ability is uniquely plausible for all of us. Cardiovascular endurance explained human propensity for athletic success. Cardiovascular endurance refers to the your fantastic human ability to sustain prolonged exercise for minutes, hours, and even days. The energy system in long distance exercises is glycolysis in the cytoplasm of cells, a cool science term for aerobic metabolism, which supplies most of the energy needed for less intense, long duration exercise that requires oodles of oxygen.1 As natural distance runners, our long-striding legs are teemed with muscles, tendons, and ligaments that are super-springy and allow us to store elastic energy in our legs and feet as we come down, recoil, then propel forward. These are impressive mechanisms perfected by the millennia of genetic mutation and survival-of-the-fittest fine tuning. The most valuable of springer muscles, the achilles tendons, aren’t even found in early humans–Australopithecus–those old school ape-like humans. Our high-end tendons evolved for distance running in the African savannah more than 2 million years ago turning us into the elite distance runners that we are now. We also have evolved large leg and foot joints which spread out high forces that must be absorbed when running. We have big gluteus maximus muscles that support two-legged stability. Our torsos counter-rotate against our hips when we run, also aiding stability. Additionally, we have a large percentage of fatigue-resistant, slow-twitch muscle fibers–equipped for endurance. Most animals are designed for sprinting because they’re either fast moving predators or prey, and their muscles have more fast-twitch fibers. For example, Cheetahs have hind-leg muscles that are the extremely fast-twitching. Think Usain Bolt like muscles–which are merely 38% of cheetah potential.2 Human endurance is biomechanically built into our genetic coding. After millions of years of evolution, we’re now designed to be exceptionally efficient in high-level running endurance. Allowing us to wake up, run a marathon, rest, and repeat. (Not professionally recommended). We not the fastest creatures capable of cheetah-speed, but we’ve been engineered to be far superior than them in cardiovascular endurance.  

Featured Image: www.atrailrunnersblog.com

 
References 1. Quinn, Elizabeth (2013, Oct 18). Endurance Training For Sports: How To Build Cardiovascular Fitness and Boost Endurance. Retrieved from: http://sportsmedicine.about.com/od/anatomyandphysiology/a/Endurance.htm 2. Stipp, David (2014, Oct 16). All Men Can’t Jump: Why Nearly Every Sport Except Long-Distance Running Is Fundamentally Absurd. Retrieved from: http://www.slate.com/articles/sports/sports_nut/2012/06/long_distance_running_and_evolution_why_humans_can_outrun_horses_but_can_t_jump_higher_than_cats_.html

Sheet1.Title: Eat, Don't Eat: How to Follow a Gluten Free Diet
Sheet1.Meta Description: The gluten free diet is simple and straightforward, this “Eat” or “Don’t Eat” structure can give you the general idea of how to eat and prepare meals. 2
Sheet1.Content:
The gluten free diet is considered the new breakthrough in health and nutrition. Many of you may be thinking how much you love being gluten free and how your health is not at risk anymore since switching over, however, the truth is, you might be unaware of the real reasons why a person needs a gluten-free diet, or what celiac disease is. You may be telling yourself “I have celiac disease”, but unless you are the 1 in 100 individuals who happen to have it, you probably don’t. This autoimmune disease can have severe impacts on your health down the line, but if you are diagnosed in your early years, you can save yourself some health problems by switching over to the gluten free diet.1 Nonetheless, whether you have celiac disease or not, you can still benefit from taking on a form of the gluten free diet. This regime allows you to avoid mass amounts of starchy carbohydrates and processed foods that you probably don’t need to consume in the first place. Gluten is a protein that is found in a few types of grains such as wheat, rye, barley, and triticale (a cross between rye and wheat). So avoiding these types of grains really isn’t that complicated when looking at the big picture. It can be tricky though, many individuals often aren’t aware of the products that may be mixed with gluten containing grains, additives, or preservatives. 1 The majority of food consumed in America’s diet contains some sort of these gluten filled grains. So when it comes to going gluten free, it is a big change and proves to be a hard task to try and stay away from grains. Though most of your previous meals consumed bread, cereals, and grains; there is a large selection of other types of grains and starches to choose from, these include:1
  • Amaranth
  • Arrowroot
  • Buckwheat
  • Corn and cornmeal
  • Flax
  • Gluten-free flours (rice, soy, corn, potato, bean)
  • Hominy (corn)
  • Millet
  • Quinoa
  • Rice
  • Sorghum
  • Soy
  • Teff
If your goal is to be gluten free and completely stay away from starchy carbs and grains and you find it to be difficult, then there may be a better alternative for you. This alternative has been around for thousands of years and has recently been reintroduced to our society. The Paleolithic diet, or “Paleo diet” focuses on the caveman foundations of health and recalls the days of our hunter gatherer ancestors. The diet is simple and straightforward, this “Eat” or “Don’t Eat” structure can give you the general idea of how to eat and prepare meals. 2 EAT:
  • Grass-produced meats
  • Fish/seafood
  • Fresh fruits and veggies
  • Eggs
  • Nuts and seeds
  • Healthful oils (Olive, walnut, flaxseed, macadamia, avocado, coconut)
DON’T EAT:
  • Cereal grains
  • Legumes (including peanuts)
  • Dairy
  • Refined sugar
  • Potatoes
  • Processed foods
  • Salt
  • Refined vegetable oils
  Whether you decide to regularly consume your meals full of grains and starches or limit them to a few times a week, following some of these guidelines will improve your overall health and help you achieve your goals.  

Featured image: Box Life Magazine

  2. Loren Cordain, Ph. D. (2014, Oct 17) What to Eat on the Paleo Diet. ThePaleoDiet.com. Retrieved from:  http://thepaleodiet.com/what-to-eat-on-the-paleo-diet/

Sheet1.Title: 6 Big Time Benefits of Fish Oil
Sheet1.Meta Description: Bodies need the benefits of fish oil. High levels of Omega-3 Fatty Acids in fish oil deliver vital nutrients to regulate and support cellular health.
Sheet1.Content:
HUMAN MACHINE: The human body is mechanized brilliance. An organic machine made up of more than 37 trillion moving parts–our cells. Every one more unique than the last. Each one tells a story about who we are, what we look like, and what we can do. Everyday, millions of our cells replicate, live, die, and repeat. It’s a never-ending cycle, a microscopic marathon in the parts-per-million. Pretty impressive machinery if you think about it.   FISH FOR THOUGHT: One of the healthiest foods for our human machines is fish. It’s because of their high levels of Omega-3 Fatty Acids (O3s) found in fish oil. They’re essentially the building blocks of healthy fats, which are vital nutrients our bodies use to regulate and support cellular health. They improve protein synthesis, and boost the nutrient delivery in/out of our cells. They literally improve the makeup of our cellular structure.   FISH OIL: It is best found in wild fish and is especially abundant in Salmon, Trout, Halibut, Sardines, Swordfish, Oysters, Tuna, Mackerel, and Herring.1 The American Heart Association even recommends that we take 1,000 mg of O3s every single day. They’re pretty much a big deal.   BRAIN HEALTH: More than half of the fats in our brains and parts of our nerve cells are made up of Omega-3 DHA–a primary component of our brains and cerebral cortexes. So, brain performance and cognitive function are strongly influenced by the amount of O3s in our diet–they enhance memory, support thinking speed, and increase our overall cognitive abilities.2   HEART BENEFITS: O3s in fish oil are also effective in reducing the incidence of cardiovascular diseases. And, can reduce the risk of common heart diseases. It also lowers our levels of bad cholesterol, and increases our levels of good cholesterol. Fish oil also prevents the accumulation of triglycerides–a type of fat found in blood that increases the risk of heart disease.3   STRONGER IMMUNITY: It is believed that regular consumption of fish oil aids in boosting our immune systems. Thus, enabling us to resist the occurrence of common illnesses such as colds, coughs, and the even the flu. Basically, fish oil has the potential to enhance the immune system of humans and help reduce associated fevers, and fatigue.   ANTI-INFLAMMATION: Fish oil is effective in reducing inflammation in our blood and tissues. Regular consumption of fish oil can be beneficial to our joints–their powerful anti-inflammatory properties reduce joint discomfort, and morning stiffness. They even reduces enzymes that destroy our precious cartilage.   BONE STRENGTH: Fish oil is also essential for optimal bone health–a vital constituent of healthy modeling bone and maintaining bone mineral density. Adding in a regular strength training routine in addition to fish oil consumption has been known to help prevent diseases like osteoporosis.4   SKIN CARE: Fish oil is also great for improving the condition of irritable, dry skin–making it shiny and vibrant. Regular consumption of fish oil even helps in reducing moisture loss from our skin.This benefits thermoregulation 5   GONE FISHING: Our bodies are like super-celled sponges–they soak up everything we give them. It’s vital that we fuel them with the best stuff on earth. From the freshest lakes to the deepest oceans, fish and their Omega-3-loaded fish oil can boost our active lifestyles up to the highest notch–giving us some big-time health benefits. The choice is ours–we can sink or swim.   Featured Image By: Joel Sartore

Sheet1.Title: Cardiovascular Endurance With A Crossfit Kicker
Sheet1.Content:
Go Farther, Faster, with CrossFit Endurance

  Cardiovascular Endurance is a valuable fitness aspect. It’s how strength of your heart, the single most important muscle in your body. When you're strong and your tough little ticker is max-healthy, you can add years, and even decades to your timeline. Your heart regulates oxygen flow to all of your mighty muscles. Cardiovascular health has a direct impact on your physical performance and body strength.1 CrossFit style exercises adds explosive movements to your workouts. Exercises that take tons of energy challenging your strength, stamina, and endurance simultaneously. When you become more explosive, you’ll start moving faster and build those explosive organic guns. Your endurance improves both fundamentally and exponentially. The reason your cardio performance can be improved is because the heart is a muscle, and like all other muscles in the body if you keep working it it will adapt to the workload given.2 It’s relatively easy to improve your endurance. It takes is a minimum of 15 minutes of exercise while in your target heart rate, 3 times a week. This isn’t the most effective way, but it’s a convenient way to get into better shape. A basic exercise program for cardiovascular training is designed for three separate training days but we’re going to do it all in one. If you haven’t joined a CrossFit gym yet, then you can test the waters before turning over to the dark side. I call this WOD the Kicker-15. It’ll take you about 2 hours. May the force be with you:
  1. Treadmill (15 mins), Rowing Machine (15 mins), Push-Ups (15, 15, 15)
  2. Cardio Bike (15 mins), Pull-Ups (15, 15, 15), Step Machine (15 mins)
  3. Treadmill (15 mins), Skipping Rope (15 mins), Triceps Dips (15, 15, 15)2
Simple stuff, repetitive, and extremely useful. “Typically the worlds best athletes are minimalists when it comes to their training. They work hard and fast with few exercises. They master the fundamentals and work with them for years."3 So, if you can master a simple WOD like this, then you can maximize your cardiovascular endurance and kick it into overdrive. But here’s the kicker, it takes time and sacrifice. Challenge accepted? Hope so. It’ll kickstart your life.  

Featured Image: www.crossfitwreckage.com

References 1. Silberman, Lindsay (2014, Oct 16). 7 Ways to Boost Your Endurance and Stamina. Retrieved from: http://www.mensfitness.com/training/endurance/7-ways-to-boost-your-endurance-and-stamina 2. General Fitness Guide (2014,  Oct 16). Cardiovascular Endurance. Retrieved from: http://generalfitness.tripod.com/id4.html 3. Glassman, Gregg (2014, Oct 17). 21 Frame Worthy Garage Gym Quotes. Sheet1.Title: Stop Inefficient Training: Nitric Oxide Benefits for Athletes
Sheet1.Meta Description: 60,000+ studies have been done on nitric oxide in the last 20 years. The role of NO is proven, but how do you enhance nitric oxide benefits long-term.
Sheet1.Content:
“It is from the greatest dangers that the greatest glory is to be won.” -Thucydides1
Nitric Oxide (NO) is radically effective for streamlining your workout performance; it’s the stuff that makes your veins jolt. It’s what fuels your inner cellular soul, sparks your mitochondrial output, and fires up your heart like a cornered rhino. It’s the same stuff that jumpstarts WODS: box jumps, kettle swings, rope throws, and AMRAPs. And it doesn’t need to be unhealthy long-term. Nitric Oxide benefits athletes in nearly every field. Now, just to clarify we are talking about the right thing: Nitric Oxide is not Nitrous Oxide. You would be amazed how confusing the two can be. Nitric Oxide is a very important naturally-occurring signaling molecule in the human body. Let’s talk about Nitric Oxide and how it separates your fitness performance from the rest.  

* ** *  

            “The bravest are surely those who have the clearest vision of what is before them, glory and danger alike, and yet notwithstanding, go out to meet it.” ― Thucydides2
 

As you research the ins and outs about Nitric Oxide, there is some basic parts of the body to understand. Trust me, these quick definitions will help you understand how nitric oxide works within the body and how to pull the performance benefits from it. Take a quick mental note:

Cardiovascular System: Controls vascular tone. Relaxes vascular smooth muscles and reduces blood pressure. Dilates vessels and relieves the pain of angina. Inhibits the aggregation of platelets within the vessels and prevents thrombotic events.

Nervous System: Acts as a neurotransmitter, including in the autonomic nervous system. Increases cerebral blood flow and oxygenation to the brain. One of the important mediators in penile erection during sexual arousal.

Lungs: Dilates pulmonary vessels. Beneficial in Adult Respiratory, Distress Syndrome, Pulmonary hypertension and Chronic Obstructive Airway Disease. Produced in abnormal amounts in inflammatory lung conditions. Concentration of NO in exhaled air can be taken as a marker of airway inflammation.

Gastrointestinal Tract: Regulates the relaxation of smooth muscles. It controls peristalsis and the function of sphincters.

Renal System: Due to its vasodilator effect, increases blood flow to the kidney. Increases the glomerular filtration rate and the production of urine.

Immune System: Modulates T cell-mediated immune response.3

* ** *

            “The society that separates its scholars from its warriors will have its thinking done by cowards and its fighting by fools.” ― Thucydides4
 

What is nitric oxide and how does it work? Some people think it's the gas that makes us laugh at the dentist office. Some think it's the fuel racecar drivers use to speed up their cars. But it's neither. Nitric oxide is a molecule that our body produces to help its 50 trillion cells communicate with each other by transmitting signals throughout the entire body.

The importance of  your body's cellular activity are far-reaching: NO production help memory and behavior by transmitting information between nerve cells in the brain, assist the immune system at fighting off bacteria and defending against tumors, regulate blood pressure by dilating arteries, reduce inflammation, improve sleep quality, increase your recognition of sense (i.e. smell), increase endurance and strength, assist in gastric motility

There have been over 60,000 studies done on nitric oxide in the last 20 years and in 1998, The Nobel Prize for Medicine was given to three scientists that discovered the signaling role of nitric oxide.

We know it is good, but how do you increase NO in a healthy way?

How to increase nitric oxide in your body: The most common way to increase nitric oxide is through exercise. When you run or lift weights, your muscles need more oxygen, which is supplied by the blood. As the heart pumps with more pressure to supply the muscles with blood, the lining in your arteries releases nitric oxide into the blood, which relaxes and widens the vessel wall, allowing for more blood to pass though. As we age, our blood vessels and nitric oxide system become less efficient due to free radical damage, inactivity, and poor diet, causing our veins and arteries to deteriorate. Think of a fire hose as water rushes through it to put out a fire - it needs to expand enough to handle the pressure, still keeping enough force to put out the fire. Athletes and youth have the most optimal nitric oxide systems, reflecting their energy and resilience.

Another way to increase nitric oxide is through diet, most notably by consuming the amino acids L-arginine and L-citrulline. Arginine, which can be found in nuts, fruits, meats and dairy, directly creates nitric oxide and citrulline inside the cell (diagram 1).(6) Citrulline is then recycled back into arginine, making even more nitric oxide. Enzymes that convert arginine to citrulline, and citrulline to arginine need to function optimally for efficient nitric oxide production. We can protect those enzymes and nitric oxide by consuming healthy foods and antioxidants, like fruit, garlic, soy, vitamins C and E, Co-Q10, and alpha lipoid acid, allowing you to produce more nitric oxide. Nitric oxide only lasts a few seconds in the body, so the more antioxidant protection we provide, the more stable it will be and the longer it will last. Doctors are utilizing this science by coating stents (mesh tubes that prop open arteries after surgery) with drugs that produce nitric oxide.5

Get the full breakdown of foods that promote natural Nitric Oxide production, HERE.

* ** *

            We must remember that one man is much the same as another, and that he is best who is trained in the severest school.” –Thucydides
  Nitric oxide for athletes and bodybuilders: Increasing nitric oxide has become the new secret weapon for athletes and bodybuilders. Athletes are now taking supplements with L-arginine and L-citrulline to support the flow of blood and oxygen to the skeletal muscle. They also use them to facilitate the removal of exercise-induced lactic acid build-up, which reduces fatigue and recovery time. Since arginine levels become depleted during exercise, the entire arginine-nitric oxide - citrulline loop can lose efficiency, causing less-than-ideal nitric oxide levels and higher lactate levels. Supplements can help restore this loop allowing for better workouts and faster recovery from workouts. With nitric oxide deficiencies due to aging, inactivity, smoking, high cholesterol, fatty diets, and lack of healthy foods, increasing your nitric oxide levels can help increase your energy, vitality and overall wellness. The basic adage of eating well and staying active all makes sense now.6 Over 300 Spartan soldiers led the fight against the mighty Persian army–led by Xerxes, an adversary of humanity. -An impossible task. As Crossfit athletes, we’re at war with mediocrity, up in arms against the processed food. It’s a battle hard won with difficult dietary choices. Nitric Oxide production will boost your cellular performance for long-term sustainable gains.
