Sheet1.Title: Dawn Fletcher (Guest V-Blog) Placeholder
5 Tricks To Reinvent Good Snacking Habits
Sheet1.Meta Description: Proteins, omegas, & antioxidants are natural performance enhancers when consumed in small portions throughout the day. To enjoy, learn good snacking habits.
Sheet1.Content:
Master the Grazing Game With Effective Tactics

  We have all heard the nagging weight control adage: "Don't snack between meals!" It's like a tug of guilt on our heartstrings as we reach for that afternoon cookie, those midnight crackers. But we are living, moving, fuel-burning creatures–snacking has become our nature in a fast-paced environment. It is unrealistic to live our lives according to the modern world's hours of operation. Three-Squares are a thing of the past. That being said, it is actually very realistic to snack on foods throughout the day that provide you nutrient-rich body and brainpower. Proteins, omegas, and antioxidants are natural performance enhancers when consumed in small portions throughout the day. They are the nutrients that are lacking when low energy strikes. But are you enjoying the benefits of good snacking habits? Use some of these easy tips for constructing new eating routines.

1.) Anticipate For A Time Crunch

If you're like me, you're not sure what the day will throw at you! Our best-laid plans may go awry, and in this event we want to be prepared for a grab-n-go mini meal. Stock your fridge with plastic baggies full of fresh veggies, fruits, and nuts to avoid last minute hassles. Vacuum seal small portions of meat or fish for much needed protein boosts. Not a meat-eater? Hard-boiled eggs, various seeds, and natural energy bars are always quick and easy when kept well stocked. Munching on these will curb the urge to succumb to the gnawing hunger that leads to a stop off at the drive-thru.

2.) Indulge, With Caution

This means rationing. Give yourself a break if you can't bear the temptation. It's OK! We're human! We sin. We eat junk food sometimes. Our bodies are actually craving two things when our mouths water for sweets. First, of course, is the taste of something delectable. Our senses trigger our brain into sending signals that we have a craving. Our first instinct is to satisfy these cravings, and by doing so, we over-indulge at times. However it is merely the taste of something that we are wanting. Those sweets do nothing for our systems and our bodies know it. A few bites of that "chocolate cake" is all that craving really needs to feel appeased. Second, the much more powerful thing our bodies are asking for during a sweets craving is more protein. We burn through the stuff like mad throughout the day and the most dangerous thing to be near when we're running on fumes is a bowl full of Hershey's kisses. -Best to keep a bowl full of almonds within reach instead :)

3.) Trade Fillers For Stabilizers

Simply put, we don't win marathons on a belly full of bread. If you sat down to dinner with my grandparents, you'd most likely get your potato, your noodles, your frozen-then-steamed peas, and don't forget the random plate of sliced bread (alongside a tub of margarine, for full disclosure here). Sure you're walking away from the table with a full stomach. What about an hour or so later? When you’re lethargic, cranky and hungry again–and its only 8pm? No disrespect to my grandparents' generation, but in relation to healthy eating, we have more options and more proven facts nowadays. Toss the barrage of grains and invest in freshness. We need grass-fed meats, fresh fish, raw vegetables and fruits within season, and a selection of healthy fats and oils. It's what a real dinner should look like. Eating habits like this will even decrease your amount of snacking altogether!

4.) Appeal To All Of Your Senses

That's right, all five of them! That inexplicable drooling you have when passing a TacoBell? That's really the salt that you smell and you don't even realize it. It’s the subconscious desire to crunch on those chips. Our brains link sound with satisfaction. The actual sound of crunching makes us want more...and more.... and more. And half the bag later... (Again, self-hatred ensues.) These are just a few examples, but to counteract these desires that have your brain captivated, try munching on carrot sticks or a handful of nuts. Drink more fluids when getting the itch to eat salty foods. Get in front of the problem, learn what your body is actually asking for, and you'll soon train your senses to crave the good stuff.

5.) Hydrate, Your Life Depends On It Anyway

It's common for people to mistake hunger for thirst. Dehydration is one of the leading factors for overeating, believe it or not. It's a silent killer for weight control, especially if you're not aware of your need for water consumption. Maintaining hydration will give you more sustained energy levels and reduce hunger pains between meals. The rule of thumb is to drink eight 8oz glasses of water each day. This is a good starting off point, but keep in mind other items you ingest can give rise to dehydration levels, meaning you sometimes need to replace what's depleted. For every cup of caffeine or alcohol you consume, you will need to match it with a glass of water. This, is in addition to your average daily intake of water. These tricks are just a few of the many ways to achieve success in healthy eating. Refueling can be necessary, but it doesn't have to be done at the doughnut counter. Grazing from an assortment of super foods and whole nutrients will propel you through that final stretch before you're able to sit down to the real meal. The effects can be astonishing for those currently suffering from fatigue, hunger pains, and lethargy at various points between meals. Try it out! You should be pleased with the outcome.
Sheet1.Categories: Health Tips | How To | Interesting Other | Nutrition Hacks

Sheet1.Title: Spicy Coconut Mayo
Sheet1.Meta Description: A paleo taste of the tropics that's loaded with healthy fats and luscious flavor. Jalapeño and coconut turn homemade mayo into something special.
Sheet1.Content:
A luscious taste of the tropics

My husband Dave and I went on a yoga retreat a few years ago in Mexico. It was meant to be the start of a new phase in our lives of saying "yes" to things we might previously have turned down, like a yoga retreat in Mexico. That trip turned out to be legendarily terrible: raging thunderstorms, voracious mosquitos, decidedly groovier-than-we-are travel companions, and a vegetarian-only dining hall. But we found solace every evening in gigantic, fresh piña coladas, sand between our toes, and breathtaking sunsets. Literally, every time I eat coconut now, I think of those blissful moments when the sun was dropping into the sea and I was shoving coconut into my maw. This coconut mayo is like the savory version of a piña colada: it's rich, creamy, and oh-so-tropical — and while it might seem indulgent, it's totally good for you. Cheers to that! Whip up a batch in a flash, then drizzle it on Oven-Fried Salmon Cakes, mix it into a can of salmon or tuna for a quick salad, or use it as a dip for raw veggies. Spicy Coconut Mayo Makes about 1/2 cup | Prep 5 minutes | Whole30 compliant Ingredients: 1/2 cup Olive Oil Mayo 1/2 small jalapeño, ribs & seeds removed, finely minced 1 clove garlic, minced (about 1 teaspoon) 1/2 tablespoon lime juice 1 tablespoon unsweetened, shredded coconut, toasted* 1/4 teaspoon Jerk Seasoning pinch salt and ground black pepper Directions: Place all the ingredients in a bowl and mix gently with a spatula until blended. Allow the flavors to meld for 10 minutes before serving. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to a week. *To toast coconut on the stovetop: Heat a large, non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the coconut and toast until lightly browned, stirring occasionally to make sure it doesn't burn. Helpful links How to crack a fresh coconut Mayo-making demo video (You can also make mayo in a jar with a stick blender!)

Sheet1.Title: Silky Gingered Zucchini Soup
Sheet1.Meta Description: Rich, luscious vegetable soup with no dairy or coconut milk -- just zucchini, spices, and broth. So easy to make and delicious any time of day.
Sheet1.Content:
Unexpectedly creamy

Since we all figured out how to turn zucchini into noodles, this mild green veggie seems to have become everyone's favorite. I like zoodles as much as the next paleo enthusiast, but my zucchini of choice these days is this zucchini soup. I've been making a batch of this stuff, with homemade bone broth, every week for about a year, and I eat a bowl almost every day. My gut has never been healthier! Plus, it's a sneaky-easy way to get an extra servings of vegetables; I love to eat a bowl alongside my breakfast. Thanks to the texture of the zucchini, the soup is creamy and rich-tasting, without any dairy or coconut milk—and it's dead-easy to make. It's barely more complicated than tossing everything in a pot, forgetting about it for 45 minutes, then puréeing it with a blender. Zip! Slurp! Silky Gingered Zucchini Soup Prep 10 min | Cook 60 min | Serves 4-6 | Whole30 compliant Ingredients: 1 tablespoon coconut oil 1/2 medium onion, chopped 4 large cloves garlic, peeled 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon powdered ginger 1 teaspoon ground coriander 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper 2 pounds zucchini (about 4), chopped 4 cups high-quality chicken broth (homemade bone broth is best!) Directions: 1. Heat coconut oil in a large soup pot on medium heat, 2 minutes. Add onions, then smash garlic cloves with the flat side of a knife or the bottom of a glass and add to pan. Stir often and cook until the onions and garlic are soft and golden, but not browned, about 7 minutes. Add salt, ginger, and black pepper; stir to combine. 2. Toss the zucchini into the pot. Stir to coat the zucchini with fat, then cook 'til beginning to soften, about 5 minutes. 3. Add the broth, bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to simmer. Let the zucchini cook 45 to 60 minutes until it's very soft. 4. VERY carefully, purée the zucchini and broth in a blender or food processor, or with an immersion blender. If you're using a blender, work in batches, filling the canister only halfway and holding a towel over the lid while you purée. Eat immediately, or store in a covered container in the fridge. Tasty garnishes: My favorite right now is dried or fresh chopped chives. The green tops of scallions are also yummy. You would not be remiss if you drizzled a little sesame oil across the top.

Sheet1.Title: Fruit Gels Recipe
Sheet1.Meta Description: This recipe describes how to make delicious fruit gels without the use of sugar in the ingredients.
Sheet1.Content:
Fruit gels everyone will enjoy

All my children are blessed with healthy appetites – they would usually eat anything I put in front of them, but like most kids, they were big fans of sugary treats. Dealing tooth ache and cavities is common for mothers, especially those like me, with more than one child. The best way to make sure they don’t miss out on eating sugary concoctions and not compromise on nutrition is to give them fruit treats. Why have fruit gels? Fruit gels don’t just taste yummy but also have a plethora of health benefits. Firstly, the recipe infuses the goodness of fresh fruit juice and provides the necessary nourishment. There is also a substance called acetylcholine in them that aids in strengthening the immune system of the body. Gels have been used to combat health conditions like ulcers, allergies, skin rashes & irritation, and for liver & kidney disorders. A few points to remember about fruit gels:
  • They contain high amounts of amino acids, including the 8 acids that aid in regulation of body functions.
  • Gels promote overall growth and development.
  • They are packed with fatty acids, folic acid, protein, Vitamin B and other nutrients.
  • Aspartic acid is present in gels, which assists in growth of muscles, tissue, and cells.
  • They have both antimicrobial and antibacterial properties.
Substituting sugar with Erythritol I usually stay away from sugar as I dedicatedly follow the Paleo diet, but anything in moderation doesn’t cause harm, which is why I have used it in this recipe. However, if you are an ardent believer in the no-sugar rule, I have suggested powdered erythritol as an alternative. It has less calories and carbs, and don’t impact blood sugar levels, thereby making it safe for both kids and adults. Erythritol is basically a sugar alcohol, which isn’t absorbed by the small intestine in small amounts as most of it passes into the bloodstream. The leftover is then ejected from the body via excretion. The best part is it doesn’t feed bacteria in the mouth, thus reducing chances of poor dental health. Since erythritol contains 70% of the sweetness of sugar, it doesn’t impact the overall taste – in fact you won’t be able to make out the difference. Fruit gels can be eaten at any time since they don’t lead to side effects. They can be taken with coconut whipped cream or slices of pineapple to enhance the flavor.   Ready to create this dish? View recipe here

Sheet1.Title: Braised Steak with Mustard
Sheet1.Meta Description: Please your guests with this delicious braised steak with mustard
Sheet1.Content:
Bring a hit to your next home party or dinner

It is a total misconception that braised steak with mustard is a complicated recipe that requires hours – in fact it is just the opposite! There are about half a dozen main ingredients and preparation time is pretty quick. I have used salt and pepper for seasoning as well as Dijon mustard, which contained verjuice, the acidic green component of unripe grapes, in place of vinegar. Some varieties have white wine instead of verjuice these days. Know all about braising Here too, I will be using grass-fed products namely, flank-steak and butter as they are much healthier in terms of nutritional value. The cooking technique in this case is known as braising, which is often confused with stewing due to which both terms are used interchangeably. There are some similarities between the methods, but a few subtle differences as well. We have come a long way from when braising meant flinging what you wanted to eat in the fire, and letting it be until it was done. Braising involves simmering food in minute proportions of liquid in a pan or casserole. While stewing involves dip the ingredients in liquid, braising needs just enough water, wine or stock for a little moisture to soften the meat. However, the end result is the same – the ingredients are tenderized and flavors are more pronounced. Flavoring and how! I used red wine for my Irish beef stew, but have opted for a crisp white variety this time. It is believed that white wine is equally efficient as red when it comes to regulating heart function and preventing blockage of arteries. The antioxidant components in white wine, such as tyrosol and hydroxytyrosol, are also quite powerful. Minced shallots also help to accentuate the taste, and offer numerous health benefits, which is why you should incorporate them into your daily diet. They act as antioxidants, promote heart health, improve blood circulation, regulate metabolism, reduce bad cholesterol, keep blood pressure in check, etc. Serving tips This braised steak can be served with a generous sprinkling of coriander on top, and sweet potato fries & roasted vegetables on the side. If you feel this combination is too filling, go for lightly toasted garlic bread or mashed potatoes. Garnishing with peppercorns is fine as long as you enjoy their distinctive taste and aroma. To enhance the tangy flavor of the steak, you can serve it with some spicy chips! Juicy, delicious braised steak with a glass of wine for dinner – how does it sound? Ready to create this dish? View recipe here
Sheet1.Categories: Interesting Other | Nutrition Hacks | Paleo Recipes

Sheet1.Title: Cauliflower Crust Pizza
Sheet1.Meta Description: Surprise your taste buds with this delicious cauliflower crust pizza
Sheet1.Content:
Surprise yourself with this delicious cauliflower crust pizza!

Originally I added cauliflower mainly to vegetable stews or noodles. The usage of this vegetable in my kitchen was completely conventional until I came across this innovative pizza recipe. Initially I was apprehensive about a cauliflower crust, but judging by the responses of my friends and family, and also after tasting it myself, I can ashamedly admit I was missing out on one of the most delectable pizzas out there! Meat quality is crucial… I would really like to draw your attention to the types of meat I have used. Proscuitto, which is cured ham made from the hind leg of a pig, is consumed as is. It is already blended with salt (and a few spices at times), but I would suggest that you fry it a bit beforehand as it provides a better finishing touch and brings out the aroma even more strongly. As for chicken sausages, I prefer to make them at home as it is both safer and healthier, which means I won’t have to obsesses about the ingredients! Why opt for hormone-free meat? A couple of hormone-free meat products are a part of the recipe as well – Canadian bacon and pepperoni – the latter being particularly vital for the pizza. Before buying, check for the USDA Organic Seal to verify if a certain product is hormone-free. I was terrified to read to about the devastating side effects caused after consuming meat full of growth inducing hormones fed to animals, which severely deteriorated the quality of meat. It is absolutely necessary to use meat products sans hormones whenever possible. To put it in a nutshell, here’s why you should switch to organic meat:
  • The meat is natural and pure.
  • Officially certified by the USDA to be safe and healthy.
  • The more organic products in the food chain, the better it is for the environment.
  • It won’t take a toll on your health because there are no harmful chemicals and hormones in it.
I used garlic powder because it tastes almost like the vegetable but doesn’t contain the harsh and caramel-like undertones. The powdered form is a slightly sweeter version too. One of the biggest advantages of this pizza is that it uses cauliflower as the base of the dough, thus preventing the carb overload of its traditional counterpart. If you prefer pizza with a spicy tang, sprinkle a generous amount of chilly flakes, cayenne seasoning or hot pepper on top. Hope you enjoy the pizza! Ready to create this dish?  View recipe here

Sheet1.Title: Gluten-Free Tabbouleh
Sheet1.Content:
Gluten-Free Tabbouleh

I got to know about the authentic Tabbouleh salad, from a few of my friends who ate and loved it. Being the food buff I am, I immediately started researching the recipe. I am all for using fresh herbs and vegetables, and the lemony kick appealed to me too, as I enjoy the citrus tang in foods, but the Bulghur wheat was a hurdle. Being an avid follower of Paleo, I wouldn’t use it, so I tweaked the recipe here and there and came up with my own version of this Middle Eastern salad.   The goodness of cauliflower…   Although I have used shredded cauliflower as the crust in my gluten-free pizza recipe, I didn’t touch upon the amazing health benefits of this vegetable. Since it is a member of cruciferous family, you should also incorporate it in your daily diet as it is packed with nutrients. It is also quite versatile – not only can you eat it raw, but it can be used in salads, soups, and various other forms of cooking. Cauliflower is useful in the following ways:  
  • Combating cancer as it contains sulforaphane that destroys cancer stem cells.
  • Both blood pressure and kidney function get a significant boost.
  • Cauliflower is infused with anti-inflammatory nutrients that control inflammation and prevent repercussions on overall health.
  • Antioxidants and phytonutrients stop organ and tissue damage by killing free radicals.
  • It flushes out toxins and harmful chemicals from the body.
  • Improves functionality of the brain and supports the digestive system with its dietary fibers.
  Why use green onions?   If you are health conscious like yours truly, then green onions or scallions must have made their way into kitchen already! Although they have the same pungent flavor like white onions, they are milder, and don’t tamper with the overall taste of the dish. Moreover, they are low in calories so having a portion of these onions on a daily basis can help to maintain proper body weight. They also contain vitamin A, lutein and zeaxanthin, which positively impact your eyesight. You can eat green onions by adding to mixed salads like whole-wheat couscous, diced mango and jalapeno, and fresh cilantro, or in wraps and sandwiches.   Mint is the surprise ingredient that adds its special touch as it helps in digestion, which is why mint tea is sometimes used for hangovers. Tabbouleh should be ideally served on a lettuce or cabbage bed with a side of French Fries – I am sure you will love it!   Get recipe HERE

Sheet1.Title: Irish Beef Stew
Sheet1.Content:
Irish Beef Stew

You don’t have to be a connoisseur of food to whip up something delectable. At times, a simple and wholesome recipe is what does the trick, as it can be incredibly tasty and quickly become one of the most loved comfort foods in your family. For instance, think back to those days, when mothers and grandmas would cook a large pot of warm stew for the whole family on a cold, wintery day, with the tantalizing aroma spreading all over the house – it was a simple meal, which was everyone’s favorite. The good old days… Although the concept of Paleo wasn’t much prevalent back then, you can cook good and hearty meals for your family based on this idea. A classic Irish beef stew is just what every family needs on a cold or rainy day when temperatures are low. Just imagine sitting around a crackling fire and spending time with your loved ones while sampling the stew – sounds great, right? This stew is suitable for kids too as it is extremely nutritious and will be in their tummies in no time, if you serve it to them when they come home from school or playing outdoors. Healthy and scrumptious Beef stew has several variations - some prefer it with more vegetables in large quantities while others might choose to experiment with the flavor by adding a few slices of an apple (yes that’s right!). I have used cubed carrots and potatoes, along with chopped garlic and onions. My objective was to create nutrient dense dish that is both tasty and healthy, which I have thankfully achieved. This stew is high on vitamins and minerals, and low on calories, so health buffs can consume it without counting calories in their minds! The role of red wine… To bring out the essence of the stew, I have added a cup of red wine since it helps to flavor and moisten the meat and vegetables while simmering. Being an acidic substance, red wine contains a lot of tang, which greatly aids the cooking process. In fact, it is used in some cakes for these very reasons – in place of fat it makes the cake light and adds on some complimentary flavors as well. Some good old-fashioned style cooking is definitely on the cards on chilly fall and winter evenings! The stew should ideally be served with breadsticks, or a light rice dish. If you opt for the latter, go easy on the dessert. Garlic bread also works as does its crusty variety, which you can break into bite-sized pieces and eat by dipping into the thick gravy! View Recipe HERE!

Sheet1.Title: Momma's Beef Short Ribs
Sheet1.Content:
Momma's Beef Short Ribs

Soft succulent short ribs – my mouth starts watering right away! What is even better is the fact that this extremely appetizing dish can be done in a Paleo-friendly manner as well. Just like my Irish beef stew; this also is cooked by sautéing with a variety of vegetables to ensure there is no shortage of nutrients, while your taste buds experience the juicy flavor. Why use grass-fed beef? In this recipe, I have used grass-fed beef short ribs for the meat. The nutrient composition of beef relies heavily on the feeding habits of cows. Cattle are often provided an unnatural diet based on corn and soy, which completely spoils the balance of saturated fat and cholesterol in their bodies. This type of beef is known as grain-fed beef and it is best to steer clear of it, since it doesn’t provide much in terms of nutrition. Grain feeding is usually done to fatten up the cows. On the other hand, beef from grass-fed cattle is much healthier because the process is completely natural and uncontaminated. Compared to its grain-fed counterpart, the grass-fed variety has the following benefits:
  • Contains more Vitamin A and E.
  • Almost zero percent chance of contracting Mad Cow’s disease.
  • Has almost 3 to 5 times more Conjugated Linoleic Acid content.
  • Higher quantities of “good” saturated fats.
  • Almost 2 to 4 times richer in omega-3 fatty acids, promoting heart health.
  • Low in calories, which help to maintain proper body weight.
Rainbow chard or spinach? I have kept both avenues open! Rainbow chard can be used in so many ways – you can either eat them raw in salads or add it to gravy, soups and stews. The name is derived from the bright yellow, red, orange and purple stalks in each bunch of chard. It imparts a fresh zest to the beef short ribs, and is almost fat-free with low calorie count. Chards are mainly used as sources of Vitamin A and K, dietary fibers, phytochemicals, and iron. If you want to add spinach, that is a good option too, since it contains antioxidants, fatty acids, protein, phosphorus, vitamin E, zinc, and other nutrients. Pay close attention during seasoning – add fresh cracked pepper in moderate amounts or else it might spoil the overall taste. Short ribs can be served with gluten-free polenta with chive flakes, roasted root vegetables, sautéed mushrooms (if you haven’t used it in the recipe), or bitter salads. See Recipe HERE!

Sheet1.Title: Paleo Brownie Pie Crust or Cookies
Sheet1.Content:
Paleo Brownie Pie Crust or Cookies

What I really love about Paleo recipes is that they use healthy ingredients without any impact on the flavor or taste. For instance, this Paleo Brownie Pie Crust or Cookie recipe doesn’t contain sugar or processed food items in any form and yet you won’t be able to resist gobbling it up when it is ready!   Using cacao as the base…   Cacao powder is one of my favorite ingredients as it offers numerous benefits. The raw beans are naturally infused with flavonoids, an antioxidant compound that improves overall health and lowers the risks of quite a few diseases. Flavonoids called anthocyanidin and epicatechins are powerful antioxidants present in large amounts. Basically, cacao should be incorporated into your diet because of the following reasons:  
  • Antioxidants play an integral role in demolishing free radicals in tissues and cells. Free radicals wreak havoc upon your health, and by removing them, you get to enjoy robust health for a longer time. Antioxidants prevent platelet changes leading to blood clots and lessen inflammation.
  • Flavonoids help to lower oxidation of bad cholesterol. High rates of oxidation lead to plaque, which causes atherosclerosis due to fats piling up in the arteries. More flavonoids in your system will improve blood circulation and reduce possibilities of heart disease.
  Going nutty…   An ardent health freak like me is always looking to provide all round nourishment, which is why I have given you different options for adding nuts. Almonds are crucial though – it is one of the main ingredients, due to its unique flavor, which wonderfully accentuates the taste in this case. Sweet almonds are loaded with nutrients like Vitamin E and B2 and protein. They are instrumental in keeping you energized throughout the day, while reducing after-meal surges in blood sugar, thus protecting against cardiovascular diseases and diabetes. The buttery essence and crunch feel of walnuts are ideal for adding to the crust. Not only are they delicious, but they also contain several components that are important to maintain optimum health. Similarly, you can use pecan nuts as well, since they have lots of monounsaturated fatty acids and phenolic antioxidants that boost good cholesterol. These nuts are also rich in minerals like manganese, potassium, calcium, iron, magnesium, zinc, and selenium. The best part is you can get creative with this recipe and tweak it to produce a different item each time. So put your apron on, and get to it right away! View Recipe HERE!

Sheet1.Title: Ribs Smoked in Home Oven
Sheet1.Content:
Ribs Smoked in Home Oven

Pork never really appealed to me as a particularly tantalizing meat. Even though I liked beef as you can well make out from my recipes, I didn’t enjoy pork as much. If I was eating ribs, I would see to it that they were cooked with ample spices and seasonings to tweak their distinctive flavor. But these pork ribs smoked at home have turned me into an avid pork eater due to their scrumptious taste!   Why use smoker bags?   I found smoker bags to be very convenient – they useful in cooking traditional smoked food in a different way. Pork ribs prepared in this way are much healthier due to low-fat content. With a double-walled plastic bag, they can be easily put in the oven or grill, and all you have to do is seal the bags tightly so the smoke inside can’t escape. It is the smoke that enhances the taste and flavor of the pork ribs. Smoker bags also mean lesser cleanup afterwards as the ribs are served right out of the bag – no muss, no fuss! Here’s why you should buy smoker bags for smoked meals:  
  • It takes just a few minutes for the food to get thoroughly cooked.
  • They are free from glue and other chemicals.
  • Easy to dispose – use and throw!
  • No need to reverse sides of the food or the bag.
  • Oven and grill is clean without sticky messes as in the case of conventional smoked dishes.
  Serving suggestions   You can enjoy pork ribs even more by pairing them with interesting sides such as:  
  • Spicy salad with black beans and avocado – you can also substitute avocado with potato.
  • Snow pea and red onion salad with sesame vinaigrette.
  • Pasta salad with asparagus and a hint of lemon to enhance the taste.
  • Honey corn bread muffins – the sweetness plays delightfully against the succulent tang of ribs.
  • Coleslaw sprinkled with caraway and raisins.
  • Grilled zucchini with green onions and lemon.
  In this recipe, I have used spare ribs instead of the baby back variety. The latter is taken from the loin section of the pig while the former is from the belly area so it contains more meat and flavor. Spare ribs are infused with proteins, vitamins, and minerals, thus contributing to nutritional value as well. They are perfect for serving at barbeque parties or picnics – the yummy, appetizing tang with tender juices hitting your palate is an indescribable feeling! See Recipe HERE!

Sheet1.Title: Spicy Turnip Fries
Sheet1.Content:
Spicy Turnip Fries

Personally I wasn’t that big fan of turnips till I found out how easily they could be integrated into the Paleo diet. Many would argue that turnips are an acquired taste due to the slightly tangy essence, but I feel that is their specialty. Turnip fries might not sound all that appetizing, but trust me, they are extremely yummy and good for health as well. Why use turnips? Turnips can offer a myriad of advantages pertaining to your health, such as:
  • These cruciferous vegetables are loaded with antioxidants and phytonutrients, whose primary function is to reduce risks of cancer.
  • Plant compounds like glucosinolates allow the liver to process toxins and fight against effects caused by carcinogens.
  • They lessen inflammation, thus preventing heart attacks and other heart related diseases. The folate content aids in maintaining good cardiovascular health.
  • Turnips contain several antioxidants like vitamin C, vitamin A, vitamin E, manganese and beta-carotene for eliminating free radicals from the body and preventing DNA damage to cells.
  • Omega-3 fatty acids act as the building blocks of the inflammation system and aid in lowering chronic inflammation.
  • They help to regulate the digestive system and feed the good bacteria in the stomach.
  • The fiber content controls the metabolic rate, supports health body weight, and maintains an active & functioning colon.
Suggestions to eat turnips in different ways! Including turnips as part of your daily diet can be done in many ways. Take a look:
  • Boil and mash them instead of potatoes.
  • Shred and add to any coleslaw recipe.
  • Slow cooked roast can become tastier with cubed turnip.
  • Chop or shred raw turnips to use as salad toppings.
  • Add them to a soup or stew at the same time as putting in potatoes.
Fresh aroma of the seasonings… The smell of parsley is so intoxicating! No wonder it used as seasoning for thousands of foods. It can complement herbs & spices and also perk up the taste of grains & pasta, which taste bland on their own. The slightly peppery flavor combined with a milder anise-like tang is why the parsley coating enhances the deliciousness of these fries. Since parsley is the parent of the plant family including caraway, cumin, celery, cilantro, chervil etc. it doesn’t hamper the individual flavors of these herbs. You can serve these with barbecue sauce as its sweetness can play perfectly against the spices, or opt for a cream cheese dip! View Recipe HERE!

Sheet1.Title: Vikings Used Cod Liver Oil, Should You?
Sheet1.Meta Description: The Superfood of Vikings, Cod Liver Oil.
Sheet1.Content:
We have been hearing a lot about cod liver oil being one of the dietary supplements that can do wonders to our health. But where did it come from, and what does it offer athletes? A bit of history first. Cod liver oil, taken from the livers of the Atlantic cod (hence, the name), was used as a food way back in the Viking Era. This raw oil was “highly valued for its powers of healing, strength, energy and stamina by the Vikings of Northern Norway.” Its first medical use was accounted for in 1789 when it was prescribed to a woman suffering from rheumatism, but it was only in 1822 when it was acknowledged for its healing powers. What nutrients does cod liver have that gives it its therapeutic properties? 1. Omega-3 Fatty Acids - Cod liver oil contains huge amounts of EPA and DHA. These Omega-3s help burn fats and promote muscle growth. They are vital to brain and nervous system function. They regulate cholesterol levels in the body, which contributes to improved heart health. 2. Vitamin A - Cod liver oil is a great source of the natural form of this important fat-soluble antioxidant. It helps prevent eye-related disorders, also supports brain health, and promotes healthy cellular growth. Aside from these, it stimulates hormone production that makes our body produce enzymes in active forms, which regulates our immune system. 3. Vitamin D - Cod liver oil has plenty of this essential nutrient that is synthesized by the skin when exposed to the sun’s UV light. It strengthens neurotransmitter operations, heart health and inflammatory responses. It also supports bone metabolism and cell functions. It prevents depression, anxiety, fatigue and more. All these nutrients work together to support athletic recovery and improve health in general. It is also important to note that cod liver oil contains a balanced amount of vitamin A and vitamin D, and that these natural nutrients always work together in allowing body processes to protect us from toxicity. And for athletes, taking cod liver oil as a dietary supplement will aid them in their trainings and workouts. Allowing them to push harder longer and recover quicker. What else? Cod liver oil supports bone health, and help prevent fractures and other injuries. It can also aid in healing skin wounds and in improving cardiovascular health. There are many decent brands of cod liver oil available in the market today, but it is recommended to choose the one that uses the traditional oil fermenting method that guarantees the retention of more of the nutrients in their ideal ratio. Also you want to look for a wild caught variety from cold arctic waters as both vitamin A & D and omega-3 contents are higher in this variety. Our cod liver oil is cold processed, fermented, and wild caught. Made from pure cod liver oil and designed with athletes in mind, as it improves recovery time, decreases post-workout inflammation, and reduces the risk of joint, soft tissue and tendon injuries. It is also the most rich in naturally occurring vitamin A and vitamin D when compared to any other brand on the market today. Sourced directly from Norway and encapsulated in a nitrogen rich vacuum environment to prevent oxidation (another problem found with less than premium brands). If you are looking to increase your overall health and athletic performance  we encourage you to give our cod liver oil a try. Each bottle contains 60, 500-mg soft gel capsules, you take two per day so this is a 30 day supply.

Our cod liver formula is also available on Amazon and in a few short months it's accumulated 80+ five star reviews. Thanks for giving it a try.

References:

Sheet1.Title: My Results With Nitrate Rich Beet Juice
Sheet1.Meta Description: I have used beet juice now a few times. I have used it prior to performing a variety of exercises, such as Zumba, power lifting, and running.
Sheet1.Content:
Nitrate Rich Beet Juice Plays a Key Role in Endurance & Performance

Do you call yourself an athlete?

If you are putting in work, maybe it's time you call yourself an athlete. Now, after a lot of work; I can proudly say that I call myself an athlete, I have never been dedicated to the idea of relying on supplements to fuel and enhance my activity. Whether it be for pre-, during, or post-workout, I just have not seen enough benefit of supplements. As a woman, my nutrition needs are not always addressed by a supplement product, aside from an occasional protein powder and beloved paleo nutrition bars. Most supplements do not interest me. Social media is ablaze with supplements toting increased energy, muscle recovery, and growth, and I only vaguely care. At one point, I found myself researching some of these supplements just to see what all the hype was about. I came across warnings such as, "do not consume with coffee" and "may cause a tingling sensation." Yikes! I immediately vowed to not try these supplements because they clearly came with some heavy side effects. Not cool. That is, until recently when I began hearing more chatter around the benefits of nitrate rich beet powder. After some reading and searching, I tried Beet Nitrates from AMRAP. AMRAP's Beet Nitrate formula is freeze dried beetroot powder that, when mixed with water, can be used as an plant-based, Paleo-friendly, pre-workout drink. It is an endurance juice with simple easy-to-digest ingredients. There is nothing scary about this formula; beets, sea-salt, and stevia, and the payoff is big.

 Why beets, you ask?

Since beets are rich in Nitrates (NO3), the mix becomes absorbed into the bloodstream and is secreted into saliva. The bacteria in your mouth converts the Nitrates into Nitrite (NO2). When the NO2-rich saliva gets swallowed, the Nitrite is re-absorbed and loses oxygen to become Nitric Oxide (NO). The NO then boosts your stamina, which helps you exercise for an extended period of time and also improves blood flow and pressure. I've found that AMRAP's Beet Formula allows you to work out to your greatest potential. I have used AMRAP Beet Nitrates now a few times. I have used it prior to performing a variety of exercises, such as Zumba, power lifting, and running. The greatest success that I found with using it has been that it has increased my endurance. Some of my workouts can last as long as two hours depending on the day of the week and the part of the body I am targeting that day, so energy boost I gain from a healthy beet juice is insanely helpful. With this energy increase, I have also found that I am able to endure longer workouts, which has motivated me to increase my workout time. Even though I haven't seen an improvement in, say, my running time in the short term, it certainly makes for an easier and more effective workout. I would highly recommend the Beet Nitrate formula from AMRAP Nutrition for any athlete that is looking for a safe, plant-based alternative to a traditional pre-workouts or endurance powders. It is made by people I trust, and who have my best interests at heart because they use beet juice in the same way.

My Favorite Features

  • All my friends can say a brief prayer to the gods in the sky - as nasty as a instant beet juice sounds, it actually taste really good; it's sweet and not earthy like you would think.
  • It only takes 20 - 30 minutes to kick in and the benefits last upwards of 4 or more hours. Perfect if you have event and you want the edge but not risk a full stomach prior to your race.
  • Boy's this is good for you 'down-stairs', it helps with blood flow and relaxes your blood vessels. You and your partner will be surprised ;-)

 Learn more...

Read these three articles for a terrific grasp of the basics of beets and how to use them in your fitness.
  1. Beet Juice Can Improve Your Performance - Breaking Muscle
  2. How Much Beet Juice, and When - Runner's World
  3. The Truth About Beet Juice - WebMD

Sheet1.Title: Garage Gym Inspiration
Sheet1.Content: If you're anything like us you probably love digging around the internet drooling over other people's garage gyms.  Well, with our garage gym giveaway going on RIGHT NOW we wanted to add a little fuel to the fire.  Check out some of these awesome home gyms.  Just be warned, your hands may get a little sweaty looking at them. You may also get a little jealous...  Maybe angry.  But at the end of the day, hopefully you'll be inspired.

Sheet1.Title: How To Whitelist An Email Address
Sheet1.Content:
Thank you for subscribing to AMRAP Nutrition.

Many e-mail and Internet companies are now using programs to block unwanted e-mail, often called spam. Sometimes, however, these programs block e-mail you want to get.

To Ensure You Are Receiving Your AMRAP Nutrition Emails Do The Following: Be sure to add the corresponding AMRAP Nutrition email addresses to your email white list to ensure the best chance of receiving our content and updates

Whitelist these two email addresses: For customer service, important update, flash sales and giveaways support@amrapnutrition.com and ron.slavick@amrapnutrition.com

"A whitelist is a list of accepted items or persons in a set…. a list of e-mail addresses or domain names from which an e-mail blocking program will allow messages to be received."

Gmail

1. In your inbox, locate an email from support@amrapnutrition.com (ex. your welcome mail or order confirmation) and ron.slavick@amrapnutrition.com (our Founder / CEO ).

2. Drag this email to the “primary” tab of your inbox.

3. You’ll see that our emails will go to your primary folder in the future!

 

 Yahoo! Mail

When opening an email message, a “+” symbol should display next to From: and the sender’s name. Select this and an “Add to contacts” pop-up should appear. Select “Save”:

 Mac Mail

Select “Mail” and “Preferences” from the top menu. In the “Preferences” window, click the “Rules” icon. Click the “Add Rule” button. In the “Rules” window, type a name for your rule in the “Description” field. Use the following settings: “If any of the following conditions are met: From Contains.” Type the sender’s email address in the text field beside “Contains.” Select “Move Message” and “Inbox” from the drop-down menus.Click “Ok” to save the rule.

 Outlook 2003 & Later

Right-click on the message in your inbox. Select “Junk E-mail” from the menu. Click “Add Sender to Safe Senders List.” *remember to have an awesome day!

Sheet1.Title: Five Healthy Weight Loss Habits
Sheet1.Content:
Following this formula is simple and I feel that you must master each habit in order, as they all build upon one another. However, more rewarding than the results is the process. You will find that the self-discipline, personal toughness and satisfaction you earn in pursuing your goals is spiritual in nature.

"Nothing worth having comes easy." 

1.) Eliminate Processed Sugar (and Soda)

Admit it, you often get sick right around the holidays. Ever wonder why? This is due to eating tons of sugary snacks and desserts. Who doesn't love those cookies, cakes and pies for every meal during the holidays.  But you have to understand that processed sugar will destroy your body. Not only does it make you fat, it will make you sick. It causes inflammation, joint pain, and hardening of the arteries. It can also weaken your immune system and cause cancer. It is also important to note that blood sugar spikes are the real cause of weight gain, not fat consumption. So if you want to lose weight, you are better off eating an entire stick of butter than you are drinking a can of soda (or mocha-frappuccino).

*Diet soda is actually worse, basically, they increase sugar cravings while changing the way your brain responds to simple sugars, causing your body to store them as fat.

2.) Drink Lots of Water

Facts: our brain is 90% water and our body about 70%; the majority of our blood and every cell in our body are composed of water. Meaning, we need water for our body to function properly. Water helps us think, focus, concentrate, recover, heal and function. It will increase your energy and endurance, keeps you active and alert. Flushes out toxins, boosts your immune system, and keeps you alive.  So make it a daily habit to drink a lot of water (I'm 160lbs, very active and drink 3-liters daily) . To accomplish this you will need to keep it with you at all times (I prefer these water bottles). If you need to get up every time you get thirsty you're drinking too little too late.

ProTip - To improve digestion try not to drink too much water right before a meal, because you don't want to dilute your stomach acid. I also press a lemon or lime into a glass of water following my meals, the citrus juice acts like an enzyme and will improve the digestion of your food.

3.) Morning Cardio

Start each morning with a slow jog, ranging from 25 to 45-min in length. For weight loss this works best on an empty stomach before breakfast while your blood sugar levels are depleted. Morning exercise is also good for the brain and now the primary reason I jog every morning. If your goal is to lose weight, a good rule of thumb for cardio is to maintain the ability to have a conversation but at the intensity where it's difficult to talk too much. Depending on your fitness level, you can start off by walking for 20 minutes, then walk-jog until you’re jogging for 20 minutes, and then increase just a little every week. But you must go for more than 20 minutes, as it takes your body that long to get to the fat burning stage. ProTip - Start slow and at your own pace. You’ll be doing this new habit for years and you don't want to make the common mistake of going too hard too fast and burning out. In fact, if you hold back at the beginning it will be frustrating but will increase the likelihood that this new habit sticks. 

4.) Salads For Dinner

Make it a habit to prepare a big salad with good protein every night instead of the carb heavy meal you usually have for dinner. You can have amazing salads with tons and tons of veggies and protein, covered with healthy fats like olive oil, nuts and avocado. Just remember that the goal here is to put your food on top of lettuce instead of potatoes and rice. Sounds horrible? Definitely not! It could take some getting used to, but once you do, you will be amazed on how good you feel and how much better you sleep at night.

5.) Six Meals Per Day

Avoid having three heavy meals per day. Why? Heavy meals tend to "shock" your system and will temporarily suck your energy. Your blood sugar level increases, but once the meal is fully digested, it falls abruptly, taking your energy and mood along with it. Having small meals five to six times a day help prevent this, making our bodies function more efficiently the whole day. The small, regular introduction of food keeps our energy levels balanced, making it easier for us to manage our activities and responsibilities for the day. This also gives us the chance to have more variety in our diets, enabling us to get more of the nutrients we need. With each meal I strive for two different sugars, two carbs, a protein and a fat.  This was my breakfast today: 1/2 banana 1/2 orange 2 eggs 1/2 cup rice 1 piece of toast with olive oil *If you want to accelerate weight loss, eat fibrous carbs (ie. asparagus, broccoli, brussel sprouts)  instead of starchy carbs (ie. rice, bread, oats, pasta).

Sheet1.Title: How To Form Habits That Stick
Sheet1.Content:
In a previous post, I shared my "Five Healthy Weight Loss Habits". This is the method I personally use and share with other interested in losing weight.  However, it is only effective when it becomes a habit. Just think about it. Can we lose weight and maintain good health by not drinking a can of soda for just one day? I don't think so.  Now, I will share with you what I've learned over years of trial and error as the best method for developing habits.  This is the process by which new behaviors will become automatic and once habits become automatic they take little to no willpower to maintain.
  The main takeaways from this blog post:
  1. Willpower is a limited resource, protect it.
  2. Once formed, habits take little to no willpower to maintain.
  3. While establishing a new habit you NEVER miss two days in a row.

PROOF: No matter how tired you are before bed; you will still brush your teeth. Right?

How To Form Habits That Stick

These steps are quite easy once you commit yourself to follow them. Did you really think that I would give you those weight loss tips and not teach you a way to make them stick? No way, it's my job to help you realize your full potential... so let's get started! 

1.) Form One Habit At A Time

In habit formation, it is imperative that we keep our focus and ONLY work to form one habit at a time. Trying to do more than one at a time will often results in failure. So no matter how good you think you are at multi-tasking, it is not the same with habit formation so get focused.  So, how should we start? Step 1: Make a list of the most important activities that you want to turn into a habits. Think of the 80/20 rule, what single habit will give you the biggest bang in life. Spend some time on this, because often people "don't plan to fail, they fail to plan".  Step 2: Prioritize your list. After step one you should have 10 - 20 new habits on your list. Now organize them by priority. Which is the MOST important, which is the second, etc...  Step 3: Get started. It takes 21-days to develop the neural pathways. So for these first 21-days shoot for 100% completion rate. Really strive not to miss a single day. I know it will be tough at first but in three short weeks it will become... a habit. Step 4: It's inevitable that you will miss a day and will need to regroup. If for some reason you do miss a day under NO circumstances are you allowed to miss two-days in a row, ever. This is the secret and the reason your habits will now stick.

Main Takeaway - You never miss two-days in a row, ever!

Sheet1.Title: 10 Ways To Maximize Your Post-Workout Recovery
Sheet1.Content: To optimize your downtime, you also need to take specific steps to heal your body and get yourself ready for the next big push. Here are some guidelines for maximizing your recovery and athletic performance:   Night Night In general, you should try to get at least 7.5 hours of sleep a night, although younger athletes may need up to 9 hours. We can't express how important a good night’s sleep is to a recovering athlete. This is when your body heals, repairs and detoxes. Tips: Use a Fitbit Charge 2 to monitor your sleep. It can help you quickly identify what helps and hampers your sleep, so that you can remedy any problems. Supplements such as ZM Plus help promote deep REM sleep to ensure that you get enough high quality rest to recover, function and thrive the next day.   Your Diet More important than what you eat immediately after your training session is the quality of food you eat throughout the day. Avoid all processed sugars, limit caffeine (and other stimulants) and control insulin levels by eating fats and protein with every meal. Tips: Buy a high-quality Blendtec blender and fall in love with smoothies! Many athletes “supercharge” them with our Super Berries or Supergreens powders. Help your body convert fat into usable energy by adding coconut MCT powder to your morning coffee. Blend and enjoy the benefits of ketosis.   Dehydration Dehydration can damage muscles and significantly reduce the body’s ability to repair itself. Make sure you get plenty of water throughout the day. To ensure you always have water available, we recommend ordering two or three of these Nalgene water bottles. Tips: Make sure you’re getting enough high-quality Himalayan sea salt throughout the day to improve your electrolyte balance.   Help detoxify your system by squeezing some lemon juice into your water first thing in the morning – before breakfast, coffee or even your shower. Endurance athletes can see an immediate boost in recovery and performance by drinking nitrate-rich beet juice 30 minutes prior to a workout.   Protein Athletes need the amino acids found in protein. It’s vital to build, repair and heal muscles after a strenuous workout. The best sources of protein are high-quality grass-fed or wild-caught meats. Tips: Take a Glutamine supplement. Glutamine is a natural amino acid found in meats, eggs and kale that speeds up recovery and reduces muscle soreness. Because it’s hard to get enough from diet alone, a supplement can make a big difference. Try our BCAA powder – it’s super-high-quality, vegan-friendly and unflavored. Take it before your workout to recover faster and build stronger, denser muscles.   Stretching As an athlete, you need maximum flexibility in order to get the most out of your workouts and recovery. Stretching is also the best way to prevent injury. Tip: Stretch at least 10 minutes after every workout, using “long-hold” stretches (these straps help). Before the workout, do more active stretches in which you hold positions for just a moment.   Smash-N-Mash Much of the soreness that accompanies exercise results from the muscles and fascia – the connective tissue that runs through the body – becoming knotted. Foam rolling, or self-myofascial release, is an essential part of recovery, regardless of your athletic level. Tip: This is an inexpensive foam roller that every household should own. Also, lacrosse balls are perfect for getting deep into thick muscles.   HRV Score HRV (heart rate variability) is a non-invasive and simple way to check in with your body to see what level of stress you can endure. By taking a daily HRV reading, you can better understand how hard you should push yourself on any given day. Tip: We recommend the free “Elite HRV” app and this Bluetooth heart-rate monitor, which is sensitive enough to measure your HRV.   Active Recovery Rest days provide a necessary break from the strenuous exertions of training. While you shouldn’t push yourself on your off days, some light exercise like taking a walk or an easy bike ride will promote blood flow and help speed up the recovery process. Tip: Get an audiobook account at audible.com to help pass the time and nourish your brain during “active recovery” days.   Relax Your Mind Chronic stress can aggravate inflammation, negatively affect your sleep, and impede your body’s ability to recover.  To help you bounce back faster and become more resilient, meditation is a great practice. Mindfulness meditation is the go-to form of meditation for athletes. Tip: Find a mindfulness meditation coach near you, or download the free iPhone “Headspace” app.   Take a Deep Breath The “4-7-8” technique is a simple breathing exercise that relaxes your body and calms your autonomic nervous system.  Simply breathe in for 4 seconds, hold for 7 seconds, and breathe out for 8 seconds. Do this for as little at 2 minutes and you will feel like a different person. Tip: Even if you’re an experienced athlete, practicing the “4-7-8” exercise will boost your performance and enable you to go beyond what you thought possible.
